children.definition: encircle, encompass, Arist. HA 533b11, LXX Ge. 19.4, PLond. 2.681.9 (iv A.D.), etc.:—more freq. in Med., surround an enemy, Hdt. 8.78, X. An. 6.3.11, etc.; in tmesi, Ar. Av. 346.

children.label: II
children.definition: go round, Luc. Ocyp. 63.
encircling, encompassing, Th. 3.78.

definition: περικυλινδέω, later περι-κυλίω [ῑ], fut. -κυλίσω Vett.Val. 115.21: aor. 1 - εκύλῑσα :—

children.definition: roll round, [ὀνίδα] περικυλίσας τοῖν ποδοῖν Ar. Pax 7; περικυλίοντες εἰς τὴν γῆν τὰ σώματα D.H. 9.21, cf. D.S. 18.34 :— Pass., of an infant, Sor. 1.85 ; of the shoulder in reducing dislocation, Gal. 18(1).327 : abs., roll about, Pl. Lg. 893e : metaph., to be involved in, βιαίοις πράγμασι Vett.Val. 42.9, cf. Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.206; εἰς ἕτερα πάθη Gal. 19.572.

data.quote: περικυλίοντες εἰς τὴν γῆν τὰ σώματα

children.definition: rolling round, revolution, Gal. 18(1).326.
heave or surge around, c. acc., Orph. H. 83.3.
surrounded by the waves, of islands, E. Tr. 800 (lyr.); Λέσβος Archestr. Fr. 59.4, cf. Fr. 4.5.
to be quite convex, Parth. ap. Ath. 11.783b.
convex, S.E. M. 7.307, Gal. 18(1).787; τὸ π. [τῆς γαστρός] Ruf. Anat. 40.
cover with leather, Suid. s.v. κύτος.
to be bent all round, Apollon. Lex. s.v. κύπελλον.
bent all round, π. ἔκπωμα, = ἀμφικύπελλον, EM 549.14, Orion 81.18.
wail around, Opp. H. 4.259, Q.S. 3.742 :— Pass., Hsch.
carouse round, παλαίστρας Ar. V. 1025.
smear all over with pitch, π. τὰ ἐμβάδια black shoes, Ar. V. 600.

definition: περιλαβεύς, έως, ὁ, a surgical instrument, Hermes 38.283.

children.definition: rend all round, LXX 4 Ma. 10.8 ( Pass.).
chatter exceedingly, gossip, Ar. Ec. 230, M.Ant. 1.7; τὰς τραγῳδίας . . τὰς περιλαλούσας (sc. of Euripides) Ar. Fr. 376.
describe, Philostr. Im. 2.9.
talk round a subject, Gal. 8.675,18(2).901.
prating, gossip, glosson στωμύλματα, Hsch., EM 729.32 (pl.).
much talked of, famous, of things and persons, Agath. 2.15, 4.26, Hsch. s.v. περιλεσχήνευτος.
very talkative, Suid. s.v. κομψόν.
embrace, τινα X. An. 7.4.10, Smp. 9.4, LXX Ge. 29.13, etc.; grasp, ταῖς χερσὶν πέτρας Pl. Sph. 246a : hence πολλὸν τοῦ ἀσφαλέος π. Hp. VM 9.

encompass or surround an enemy, Hdt. 8.7, 16, Plb. 2.29.5, etc. ; μετεώρους τὰς ναῦς π. intercept them at sea, Th. 8.42 ; χάρακι π. κύκλῳ τὴν πόλιν Plb. 1.48.10 ; ἐπεὰν δὲ αὐτὸν περιλάβῃς when you get hold of him, catch him, Hdt. 5.23 ; πανοικίῃ τινὰ π. Id. 8.106; π. τὸν θῆρα Pl. Sph. 235b; π. τόπον ὑπὸ [διφθέραις] cover it over, Phylarch. 41 J.; also of water, πλείω π. τόπον Plb. 4.39.8 :— Pass., to be caught, trapped, οἴμοι, περιείλημμαι μόνος Ar. Pl. 934; τῷ καιρῷ περιληφθέντες constrained by . . , Plb. 6.58.6, etc.
compass, get possession of, ἅπαντα τὰ ἐκείνου Is. 8.37; πάντα π. ταῖς ἐλπίσιν Plb. 8.1.3; acquire an art, Phld. Rh. 2.21 S.
enclose a rectangle, Pl. Tht. 148a ; of a sphere, contain the regular solids, Id. Ti. 33b.

children.label: II
children.definition: encase or cover all round, τοῦ τείχους χαλκῷ τὸν περίδρομον Id. Criti. 116b ; νεύροις . . κύκλῳ κατὰ κορυφὴν περιειλημμένη Id. Ti. 77e; χρυσαῖς λεπίσι περιληφθῆναι Plb. 10.27.10 ; χαλκοῖς ἥλοις Moschio ap. Ath. 5.207b:— Pass., of substances taken in a medium, Ph. Bel. 89.17.

children.label: III
children.definition: comprehend, include, ἐν κεφαλαίοις τὴν δύναμιν ὅλου τοῦ πράγματος Isoc. 2.9; τῷ λόγῳ Id. 8.141 ; τῷ λόγῳ τὸ ὄν Pl. Sph. 249d ; πολλὰ εἴδη ἑνὶ ὀνόματι ib. 226e, cf. Plt. 288c ( Pass.); δύο γὰρ ὄντα αὐτὰ καὶ . . τρίτον ἄλλο εἶδος ἓν ὄνομα περιλαβόν since one name includes the two, and a third class besides, Id. Lg. 837a ; μιᾷ ἰδέᾳ καθʼ ἓν ἕκαστον π. Id. Phdr. 273e ; π. πάντα D. 61.30 ; π. τῇ διανοίᾳ τὸ μέλλον Plu. Luc. 9; τὴν ἱστορίαν γραφῇ Id. Cic. 41 ; π. τὴν . . διάλεκτον compass it (Coraës παραλαβεῖν), Id. Ant. 27; βραχεῖ λόγῳ π. Luc. Peregr. 42 ; π. ταῖς συνθήκαις τινά Plb. 5.67.12 ; ὅσα μὴ σφόδρα περιείληφε ἓν ὁ νόμος τι προσαγορεύσας Lycurg. 9 :— Pass., θήρα πάμπολύ τι πρᾶγμά ἐστι περιειλημμένον ὀνόματι νῦν σχέδον ἑνί Pl. Lg. 823b; περιληφθῆναι τοῖς νόμοις Arist. Pol. 1287b19; τοσούτων περιειλημμένων κακῶν Phld. Sto. 339.13 (- ειλλημε- Pap.).

data.quote: ἐν κεφαλαίοις τὴν δύναμιν ὅλου τοῦ πράγματος
ὅσα μὴ σφόδρα περιείληφε ἓν ὁ νόμος τι προσαγορεύσας
θήρα πάμπολύ τι πρᾶγμά ἐστι περιειλημμένον ὀνόματι νῦν σχέδον ἑνί

children.definition: very brilliant, αὐγαί Ph. 1.485 ( Sup.), cf. Max.Tyr. 39.4 ( Comp.): metaph., Plu. Fab. 19: neut. as Adv., στίλβων ὀξὺ καὶ π. Id. Crass. 24, etc.
shine around or brightly, Plu. Cam. 17; πρὸς τὴν σελήνην Id. Arat. 21, etc.:— Med., περιλαμπομένας φύσεις ὑπερβάλλειν λαμπρότητι D.S. 3.12; τῷ χρυσῷ Luc. Ind. 9.

children.label: II
children.definition: light up, πολεμίῳ πυρὶ τὴν Ἑλλάδα π. Demad. 39 ; illuminate, τὰ κεκρυμμένα τῶν ἀδικημάτων ταῖς ἀκτῖσι Ph. 1.634; shine around, Plu. Cic. 35; φῶς π. τινά Act.Ap. 26.13, cf. Ev.Luc. 2.9:— Pass., to be illumined, φωτί, ὑπὸ τῆς φλογός, Plu. Per. 39, Dio 46; ὑπὸ τῶν ἀστέρων Luc. Dom. 8.

data.quote: τὰ κεκρυμμένα τῶν ἀδικημάτων ταῖς ἀκτῖσι

children.definition: shining round, radiation, Plu. Fac.lun. 2.931a, Plot. 5.1.6, 5.3.15.
suck or lick all round, Pherecr. 23 ( περιλέψαντες Herm.).
with a variegated border, Hsch.
express by circumlocution, Hermipp. 92, Poll. 2.125.
remainder, residue, Pl. Mx. 236b (pl.).

remain over, survive, ὅσσοι δʼ ἂν πολέμοιο περὶ στυγεροῖο λίπωνται Il. 19.230 ; τὸν περιλειφθέντα Hdt. 1.82; ὑπὸ τῶν κόρεων εἴ μού τι περιλειφθήσεται Ar. Nu. 725; τοὺς περιλελειμμένους φίλων E. Hel. 426, cf. Pl. Ti. 23c ( Pass.), Arist. Oec. 1350a29, etc.

data.quote: ὅσσοι δʼ ἂν πολέμοιο περὶ στυγεροῖο λίπωνται
ὑπὸ τῶν κόρεων εἴ μού τι περιλειφθήσεται

children.definition: lick all round, τὰ βλέφαρα Ar. Pl. 736; Σοφοκλέους . . τὸ στόμα Id. Fr. 581 ; of a parasite, πολλῶν . . λοπάδων τοὺς ἄμβωνας -λείξας having licked them clean, Eup. 52 ; τὸ τρύβλιον Luc. Gall. 14.

children.label: II
children.definition: lick off, τι Arist. HA 605a4; τῶν ὀβολῶν τὸν ῥύπον Luc. Icar. 30.
circumlocution, Ar. Nu. 318.

definition: περιλεπίζω, = sq., Ph. Bel. 88.47, Diench. ap. Orib. 4.7.15, Paul.Aeg. 1.81, Sch. Ar. Lys. 736.

children.definition: strip off all round, περὶ γάρ ῥά ἑ χαλκὸς ἔλεψεν φύλλα Il. 1.236; περιλέποντες τὸν φλοιόν Hdt. 8.115; peel, Thphr. HP 6.4.10 ( Pass.); v. περιλάπτω.

data.quote: περὶ γάρ ῥά ἑ χαλκὸς ἔλεψεν φύλλα

children.definition: talked of in every club ( λέσχη), matter of common talk, Hdt. 2.135.
whiten all round, πέτρας Ach.Tat. 1.1.

definition: περιλεύκιος (sc. λίθος), ὁ, name of a stone, Herm. Trism. in Rev.Phil. 32.274.

children.definition: edged with white, Callix. 2.
περίλευκον (sc. ἱμάτιον), τό, garment edged with white, Antiph. 297.
embrace, LXX Ec. 3.5 (v.l.), EM 175.7.
that may be taken hold of, of loose skin, Arist. GA 719b6.

children.label: II
children.definition: comprehending, i.e. understanding, π. τρόπος Epicur. Nat. 28.2. Adv. - κῶς with comprehension, ib. 7, prob. in Id. Ep. 1p.6U.

comprehending, including (as the greater the less), τινος Plu. Def.orac. 2.428d, cf. QPlat. 1003d, etc.; πάντων A.D. Synt. 40.13 (v.l.), cf. 285.4; τὸ καθολικὸν π. τῶν ἐπὶ μέρους S.E. M. 11.9, cf. 7.143: Comp. - ώτερος Procl. Inst. 143 : Sup. - ώτατος Id. in Prm. p.858S.; collective, ὄνομα D.T. 637.13, Hdn. Fig. p.87S., EM 264.45; σχῆμα, in Rhet., Ulp.ad D. 23.63.

data.quote: τὸ καθολικὸν π. τῶν ἐπὶ μέρους

children.definition: embraced or to be embraced, comprehensible, οὔτε νόῳ περιληπτά Emp. 2.8; νοήσει, δόξῃ π., Pl. Ti. 28a, 28c; τὰ π. things mentally comprehended, Epicur. Ep. 1p.6U.; πᾶν μῆκος π. any conceivable distance, ib. p.10 U.; π. διανοίᾳ Phld. D. 3.15, S.E. M. 9.409; π. ἀριθμῷ Plu. Cam. 43. Adv. - τῶς, f.l. for - τικῶς, Epicur. Ep. 1p.6U.
involved in, παραισθήσει . . περιληπτὴν αἴσθησιν Phld. Piet. 116.
grasping with the hand, Poll. 9.98 ; embracing, LXX Ec. 3.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: comprehension, ἐν τῇ π. τῆς ἀρχῆς τῆς ψυχικῆς in the fact of their comprehending the vital principle, Arist. GA 762a25, cf. Epicur. Ep. 1p.16U. (pl.); ἐπιστημονικὴ π. Procl. in Alc. p.276 C.; εἰς καθολικὴν καὶ ἔντεχνον π. πεσεῖν admit of general and technical comprehension, D.H. Comp. 12.

children.label: III
children.definition: inclusion, κατὰ περίληψιν S.E. M. 10.99, 286, cf. Procl. in Euc. p.395 F.
that which includes or comprehends, [ θεὸς] πάντων π. καὶ μέτρον Plot. 6.8.18 ; ἡ ἡνωμένη π. ἣν σπέρμα πάντων ἐκάλεσε Dam. Pr. 98.
surround with water, insulate, τὴν πόλιν Th. 2.102.

children.label: II
children.definition: become a lake, Ael. NA 16.15.

definition: περιλιμπάνω, later form of περιλείπω, Simp. in Epict. p.119 D. ( Pass.), Sch. Ar. Pl. 554, etc.

children.definition: very moist and shiny, βλέμμα Paul.Aeg. 3.71.
left remaining, surviving, c. gen., π. τῆς φθορᾶς Pl. Lg. 702a : abs., Plb. 1.73.2 ; π. σχεῖν Str. 8.7.5.
γλώσσῃ γένειον Theoc. 25.226, cf. Arat. 1115, Phylarch. 27 J., Luc. Merc.Cond. 34, DDeor. 20[12].2 : in pass.sense, Pl. Ax. 372a.
lick up, τὸν ἑαυτῶν φόνον Plu. Pyrrh. 31 ; τοῦ ψωμοῦ τι Luc. Prom. 10.
licking all round, Sch. Arat. 1114.
desire greedily, Ph. 1.446 ; cf. περιιχνεύω.
D.H. Amm. 2.3.

definition: περίλοιπος, ον, = περιλιπής, Ar. Fr. 160, Th. 1.74, al., Arist. Oec. 1350b13, LXX Am. 5.15.

children.definition: wash all over, Plu. Lyc. 16, Pomp. 80.
bend, [ῥάβδους] πρὸς τὸ ἐναντίον Olymp. in Alc. p.54 C.: — Pass., Hsch.
extreme grief, D.L. 7.97.
very sad, deeply grieved, Hp. Acut. 42 ; opp. περιχαρής, Isoc. 1.42, Arist. EN 1124a16; στυγνὸς καὶ π. Demad. 17, cf. LXX Ge. 4.6, al.
ὅταν ἡ πόλις συνάγῃ στοὰν ἢ περίλυσιν Abh.Berl.Akad. 1925(5).32 ( Cyrene, ii/i B.C.).

data.quote: ὅταν ἡ πόλις συνάγῃ στοὰν ἢ περίλυσιν

children.definition: cancellation, δανείων Sammelb. 5761.4 (i A.D.), cf. PGiss. 33.11 (iii A.D.), etc.; τοῦ πρὸς ἀλλήλους γάμου Stud.Pal. 22.51.3 (ii A.D.);= repudium, Gloss.
Ar. Ra. 1065 codd.
loosen round about, Aq. 1 Ki. 5.9 ( Pass.), Is. 52.2 ( Med.), cf. Dosith.p.434K.

children.label: II
children.definition: cancel, μισθοκαρπίαν PLips. 10ii31 (iii A.D.), cf. POxy. 323 ( i A.D., Pass.), etc.
strip, gloss on (or perh. glossed by) περιδῦσαι, Poll. 7.44 ( = Hyp. Fr. 263).
bald round about, π. ἕλκεα where the skin peels or scales off all round, Hp. Aph. 6.4 ( = Epid. 6.8.2).

definition: περιμάθησις [ ᾰ], εως, ἡ, dub. l. in Diog. Ep. 44 (pl.).

children.definition: seek round, ἰχθυάᾳ σκόπελον περιμαιμώωσα ( Ep. part.) Od. 12.95.
seek eagerly, ἀπὸ μαζῶν . . χείλεσσι γλάγος π. Q.S. 14.16.
rage round about, rush furiously about, ἄλσος Hes. Sc. 99.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be madly in love with, τινα Ael. Ep. 7 : c. dat. rei, to be mad for, χρυσῷ Naumach. ap. Stob. 4.23.7 (dub. l.).
one that purifies by magic, γραῦς π. a witch, Plu. Superst. 2.166a.
furious, mad, Plu. Aud. 2.43d, Adul. 52d, al. Adv. - νῶς Suav. ib. 1100a.
song, Eub. 46.
sparkle all round, Q.S. 5.114.
sparkling, π. ἄνθεσιν ἄχνας φλοῖσβος Hymn.Is. 165.

definition: περιμάρναμαι, poet. for περιμάχομαι, Epigr. ap. Paus. 5.19.4.

children.definition: wipe all round, τὠφθαλμὼ τούτῳ (sc. τῷ σύκῳ) π. Pherecr. 132 ; τοὺς ὀδόντας ὀθονίοις Plu. Sollert. 2.976b ; σπόγγῳ τι Aët. 8.3, cf. Gal. 12.840; τὸ πρόσωπον Sor. 2.28:— Med., περιμάξασθαι τὸν κόλπον Id. 1.61, cf. Philum. ap. Orib. 45.29.44.
wipe off, τὴν ἀκαθαρσίαν Dsc. 5.94.
purify by magic, Men. 530.21, Ph. 2.316, Plu. Superst. 2.168d ( Pass.).
go round and visit, πολλὰ ἔθνη Ps.-Callisth. 1.3 (v.l.).

fought about, fought for, ταῖσι φυλαῖς Ar. Av. 1404; τοῖς πολλοῖς [ὕδωρ] Th. 7.84 ; [ πενία] ἥκιστα περιμάχητον not a thing one would fight for, X. Smp. 3.9, cf. Pl. R. 521a, Lg. 678e ; δυναστεία ὑπὸ πάντων ἐρωμένη καὶ π. γεγενημένη Isoc. 8.65, cf. 7.24, 10.17 ; τὰ π. ἀγαθά such as are matters of contention, highly prized, Arist. EN 1169a21, cf. Pol. 1271b8, Rh. 1363a8, Epicur. Sent. Vat. 45 : Sup. - ότατος Isoc. 9.40, Plu. Lyc. 26 : in Ar. Th. 319, πόλις π., prob. with collat. sense of fought around, surrounded by battle.

data.quote: δυναστεία ὑπὸ πάντων ἐρωμένη καὶ π. γεγενημένη

children.definition: fight around one, X. Cyr. 7.1.41.
to be black all round, π. λαμπρὰ σκιεροῖς to have bright parts shaded off into dark. Plu. Isid. 2.368c.
very black, ὄνος BGU 806.4 ( i A.D., cf. Index p. 5).
blaming greatly, v.l. for πολυμεμφής, Arat. 109.
wish for ardently, in tmesi, A.R. 1.670, 771.
one must await, D.H. Rh. 9.5 ; τοὺς καιρούς Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 7.8.1.

wait for, await, c. acc. pers., Hdt. 4.89, Ar. Pl. 643, etc.; π. Τισσαφέρνην ἡμέρας πλείους ἢ εἴκοσι X. An. 2.4.1, etc.: c. acc. rei, π. ἐξ ἀγορᾶς ἰχθύδια Ar. Fr. 387.8 ; τοῦ καιροῦ μὴ περιμένοντός τι as the time could not wait for . . , Plu. Caes. 17.

data.quote: π. Τισσαφέρνην ἡμέρας πλείους ἢ εἴκοσι

children.definition: require, expect, σχολάζουσαν φιληκοΐαν Id. Apophth.reg. 2.172e.
endure, put up with, μακρὰ λέγοντας ἡμᾶς αὐτοὺς περιεμείναμεν Pl. Lg. 890e.
await, be in store for, τίς με πότμος ἔτι π.; S. Ant. 1296 (lyr.); μὴ θύσαντας δεινὰ π. Pl. R. 365a ; ἃ τελευτήσαντα ἑκάτερον π. ib. 614a.

children.label: II
children.definition: inf., οὐ περιμενοῦσιν ἄλλους σφᾶς διολέσαι will not wait for others to destroy them, ib. 375c ; ἕκαστος [τῶν λόγων] π. ἀποτελεσθῆναι awaits its accomplishment, Id. Tht. 173c; μηδʼ ἐφʼ ἑαυτὸν [τὰ τοιαῦτα] ἐλθεῖν π. D. 21.220; π. τὰ λοιπὰ μαθεῖν D.H. 1.13.

children.label: III
children.definition: wait, stand still, Hdt. 7.58, Ar. Ec. 517, etc.; π. αὐτοῦ Id. Ach. 815 ; ὀλίγον χρόνον Pl. Ap. 38c ; π. ἕως <ἂν> τὸν ὄχλον διωσώμεθα X. Cyr. 7.5.39 ; ἕως ἀνοιχθείη τὸ δεσμωτήριον Pl. Phd. 59d, cf. 116a ; μέχρι τούτου, ἕως ἂν . . D. 9.10 ; ἄχρι ἂν . . X. An. 2.3.2 ; μέχρις ἄν . . Epict. Ench. 15.
in the middle : τὸ π. the middle part, AB 354.
full all round, quite full of, τινος X. Smp. 2.11, Plu. Caes. 5.
measure all round, Luc. Icar. 6, Nav. 12.
circumference, Hdt. 1.185, 2.15, 41, Arist. Mir. 840b34, Luc. VH 2.40 ; τὸ π. τῆς περιόδου Hdt. 2.149 ; τὸ π. τῆς γῆς Ach.Tat. Intr.Arat. 29.
very large, Hom., only in Od., as epith. of Penelopeʼs web, ἱστὸν . . ὕφαινε λεπτὸν καὶ π. 2.95, cf. 19.140; later, of bulk, π. δέμας, κήτεα, Opp. H. 3.190, 5.47.
well fitting, of a garment, Aristaenet. 1.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: μετρος (sc. γραμμή), ἡ, = περίμετρον, Arist. Mir. 838b21, Thphr. HP 4.12.4, PLille 1.4 (iii B.C.), Plb. 1.56.4, Phld. Sign. 1, Str. 2.5.4.
on the forehead, ἱδρώς Hp. Mul. 2.171 (cod. θ).
bleat round, cj. for - μυκάομαι, Orph. L. 209.

senses.definition: very tall or high, ἐλάτη Il. 14.287 ; Τηΰγετος Od. 6.103 : c. gen., π. ἄλλων Arat. 250.

definition: περιμήκης, ες, Dor. περιμάκης [ ᾱ], ες, AP 6.125 ( Mnasalc.) : ( μῆκος):—

senses.definition: very tall or long, κοντός Od. 9.487 ; ῥάβδος 10.298; ἱστοί 13.107; δοῦρα 12.443; ὀϊστοί Hes. Sc. 133 ; very high, πέτρη Il. 13.63 ; ὄρος Od. 13.183 ; very large, huge, οἴκημα Hdt. 2.100 ; ἀνδρόσφιγγες ib. 175 ; λίθους μεγάθεϊ περιμήκεας ib. 108 ; ἄγκυραι Id. 7.36 : Comp. -μηκέστερος Ael. Tact. 2.7 : but Sup. -μήκιστος Plu. Comm.not. 2.1077b.

children.definition: covering for the thighs, Gloss.:—also περιμηρίδες, αἱ, ib.:—but περιμηρέδιον, τό, is f.l. for παρα-, Arr. Tact. 4.1.
wind round, περὶ ταῦτα τοὺς τόνους Ph. Bel. 65.39, cf. 46:— Pass., to be surrounded by a cord, of a temple, prob. in Abh.Berl.Akad. 1928(6).33 ( Cos, iii B.C.).
with tough sap-wood, ξύλον π. Thphr. HP 3.9.6.
prepare very craftily, contrive cunningly, ἄλλο τι . . περιμηχανόωνται Od. 7.200 ; δούλιον ἦμαρ ἐμοὶ περιμηχανόωντο 14.340.
decrease on all sides, περὶ δὲ ῥινοὶ μ. Od. 12.46.
run lead round. IG 7.3073.73 (Lebad.).
dress a wound with lint, Heliod. ap. Orib. 44.10.18, 47.15.8:— Subst. περιμότ-ωσις, εως, ἡ, dressing with lint. Id. ap. Orib. 46.19.4.
sorrow greatly over, τινι Opp. H. 4.258.
remove by softening, Sor. 1.73.
roar round, τινα Plu. Crass. 26 ; cf. περιμηκάομαι.
loud-bellowing, cj. in Orph. A. 313.
lament around, Mosch. 3.89, Q.S. 12.489.
dwell round about or in the neighbourhood, Od. 2.66, 8.551, 23.136, Hes. Th. 370, Pi. N. 8.9, etc.
to be or lie near, Od. 4.177.
one of those who dwell round, neighbour, Il. 24.488, A.R. 4.470.
round the temple, στοαί IPE 2.352 ( Phanagoria).
dwell round, A. Supp. 1021 (lyr.).
sea-sick, squeamish, D.S. 2.58.
float or flow around, ἄμυλοι π. ἡμῖν Metag. 6.11.
spread round, of fire, Plu. Dio 46.
in a carefully thought-out fashion, opp. ἁπλῶς καὶ ἀνειμένως, Hermog. Id. 2.5, cf. 9.

space between the anus and scrotum, Hp. Art. 71, 77, Aph. 4.80, Arist. HA 493b9 ; male genital organs, Id. GA 716a33 ( v.l. - ναίους), 766a5 : Gal. 19.130 has περινῷ· περινέῳ, Hsch. περίνα· περίναιον, τὸ αἰδοῖον, and περίνος· τὸ αἰδοῖον.
oscillation, swing, Apollod. Poliorc. 178.6.
bend forward and look round timidly. App. BC 4.46.

children.label: II
children.definition: incline first to one side then to the other, sway, Arist. Phgn. 808a15; of a chariot, = ἀμφαξονέω, Phryn. PS p.40 B.
slope, incline, ἐπὶ τὸν Νότον Str. 8.4.1 ; παρὰ τὴν ἑσπέραν Id. 4.1.6 ; πρὸς τὴν Ἰταλίαν Id. 7.1.5 ; καθὰ ἡ φύσις π. IG 5(1).1431.35 ( Messene, i A.D.).
project, Apollod. Poliorc. 166.11, al.
περινενευκὼς σφυγμός perh. compressible pulse, Archig. ap. Gal. 8.479, 9.86.
clouded, overcast, ἀήρ Ar. Av. 1194.
fat about the kidneys, Arist. HA 520a31, PA 672b2.
swim round, Hp. ap. Gal. 19.130 ; π. κύκλῳ τινός Arist. HA 621a18.

definition: περινέω (B), Hdt. 6.80 : aor. part. περινήσας Id. 4.164, also un contr. inf. - νηῆσαι v.l. in Id. 2.107, cf. Q.S. 3.678 ( Med.):—

children.definition: pile, heap round, ὕλην (sc. περὶ τὸν πύργον) Hdt. 4.164 ; πολὺ πῦρ Anon. ap. Suid., cf. Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.583a.
π. τὴν οἰκίην ὕλῃ pile it round with wood, Hdt. 2.107 ; ὕλῃ τὸ ἄλσος Id. 6.80.

definition: περίνεως, ὁ, gen. νεω, nom. pl. νεῳ, ( ναῦς, Att. gen. νεώς)

children.definition: supernumerary or to spare in a ship, κῶπαι περίνεῳ IG 2(2).1607.9, 19, al.; π. ὁ δεύτερος ἱστὸς καὶ . . τὰ διττὰ τῆς νεὼς σκεύη, Hsch., cf. Phot.; of persons, supercargo, passenger, opp. πρόσκωπος, Th. 1.10 ; opp. ναύτης, Ael. NA 2.15, Anon. ap. Suid.; opp. αὐτερέτης, Procop. Vand. 1.11, cf. Philostr. VA 6.12, Phot.; but, marines, opp. τριηρῖται, D.C. 49.1 : in sg., petty officer, gen. -νέου Artem. 1.35.
lotion, Gal. 19.130.
edged with purple (or with a fringe) : περίνησον (sc. ἱμάτιον), τό, robe with a purple border (or with a fringe), Antiph. 297, Men. 92, cf. Hsch.
swim or float about, D.H. 1.15; ἐν κύκλῳ Plu. Sollert. 2.977a ; π. τινί swim round . . , Q.S. 14.548.
wash off all round, περὶ δʼ αἷμα νένιπται Il. 24.419, cf. Hp. Fist. 9:— Med., Id. Mul. 2.158 ; π. τὸ σῶμα D.S. 4.51.
go round about, κυλίκων περινισομενάων as the cups go round, Phoc. 11 ; revolve, Orph. Fr. 247.11 ; come round, of time, ἁνίκα Καρνείου περινίσεται ὥρα E. Alc. 449 (lyr.).

contrive cunningly, Ar. Ra. 958 ; μεγάλα ταῖς ἐλπίσι π. form great projects, Plu. Phoc. 14 ; τὴν αὐτοκράτορα ἀρχὴν π. meditate empire, Philostr. VA 5.27 ; περινοησάτω ὅπως . . prob. in Diocl.Com. 14:— Pass., περινενοημέναι ἔννοιαι Hermog. Id. 2.9, cf. 5.

children.label: II
children.definition: consider on all sides, consider well, study carefully, Epicur. Nat. 11.6; πάντα τὸν κίνδυνον Plu. Brut. 13, cf. Hierocl. in CA 23p.469M.; understand a thing, M.Ant. 1.7, S.E. M. 2.9.
Herm. ap. Stob. 2.8.31, Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.172.
shrewdness, subtlety, Plu. Garr. 2.509e.
sustained thought, Plot. 6.9.11.
thoughtful, Poll. 2.229.
discursive in thought, λόγος Herm. ap. Stob. 1.49.4.
subtle, Procl. Par.Ptol. 231.
thoughtfulness, quick comprehension, τινος Pl. Ax. 370c : abs., Philostr. VS 2.4.2, Luc. Zeux. 2 ; ἐν περινοίᾳ γεγονέναι to have comprehended, Gal. 18(1).331.
deliberation, ἐν περινοίᾳ τοῦ μεταστήσοντος αὑτὸν ἦν J. AJ 18.6.2.

data.quote: ἐν περινοίᾳ τοῦ μεταστήσοντος αὑτὸν ἦν

children.label: II
children.definition: over-wiseness, Th. 3.43 ; subtlety, λογικὴ π. Simp. in Ph. 1205.28.

children.label: III
children.definition: disdain, contempt, Aristid. 1.141 J. (v.l.), Lib. Or. 12.48, Phot., Suid.

children.label: IV
children.definition: sharp practice, fraud, π. καὶ ἀπάτη Just. Nov. 7.12, cf. Cod.Just. 1.3.41.5.
distribution in regular order, ἐκ περινομῆς in turn, D.H. 10.57 (leg. περιτροπῆς).

children.label: II
children.definition: procession round a place, Men. 894 (pl.).

definition: περίνοος, ον, contr. περίνους, ουν, ( νοέω)

children.definition: very intelligent: Sup. περινούστατος S.E. M. 7.326.
go round, visit, inspect, περὶ τὰς κλίνας Ar. Th. 796; παλαίστρας Id. Pax 762 ; τὰ τεκτόνων ἔργα Plu. Symp. 2.155c: metaph., π. τινὰ ἀπάτῃ circumvent, Aesop. 204b.
go about, stalk about, π. ὥσπερ ἥρως Pl. R. 558a; of vagrants, Ar. Pl. 121, 494, D. 19.255; π. σχολὴν ἄγοντα Alex. 28, cf. Alciphr. 1.10 (cj.), Jul. Ep. 89.
a going about, wandering, Agath. 2.6.
moisten all round, Sor. 1.22 ( Pass.); τὸ πρόσωπον Alex.Trall.1.15.
wetting all round, Archig. ap. Aët. 3.194.
Erot.

definition: πέριξ, strengthd. for περί, mostly Ion. Prose and Trag. (in latter usu. Adv.):

children.label: I
children.definition: round about, all round, c. gen., Hdt. 1.179, 2.91, X. An. 7.8.12, Epicur. Ep. 2p.51U., etc.
Hdt. 1.196, 3.158, 4.36, al.: mostly before its case, but also after, ib. 52, 79, as also in A. Pers. 368, dub. in E. HF 243.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. round about, π. ὑπορύσσοντες τὸ τεῖχος Hdt. 5.115 ; π. λαβεῖν ἄνθρωπον to surround him, ib. 87; κύκλῳ π. A. Pers. 418, dub. in S. Ant. 1301, E. Andr. 266 ; [ Ὠκεανὸς] π. γᾶν ἀμπέχει Limen. 10 : metaph., πᾶν π. φρονοῦντες circuitously, E. Andr. 448 : rare in Att. Prose, π. πολιορκεῖν Th. 6.90; ὁ π. τόπος, οἱ π., Pl. Ti. 62e, X. Cyr. 1.5.2, cf. Epicur. Ep. 2p.47U.; ὁ π. χρόνος, i.e. all times save the present, Arist. Int. 16b18 ; τὸ π. ὕδωρ Thphr. Sens. 26 ; later αἱ π. πόλεις Act.Ap. 5.16 ; αἱ π. κῶμαι SIG 880.44 ( Pizus, iii A.D.).
suffer laceration upon, ταῖς ἀπορρῶξιν J. BJ 3.9.3.
polished round about, πέτρη Od. 12.79.
polish all round, Theoc. 22.50, Supp.Epigr. 4.446.13 ( Didyma, iii B.C.), Gal. UP 16.11:— Pass., Lib. Or. 18.219.
scrape all round, Hp. Mul. 2.144.
become dry all round, Arist. GA 758b25, Pr. 870a24.
dry round about, ἀήρ Thphr. Ign. 41 ; χώρα Gp. 2.13; σύγκρισις Philum. ap. Orib. 45.29.36; τὸ π. the crust, Arist. GA 737a36.
shave all round, τοὺς κροτάφους v.l. in Hdt. 3.8:— Pass., περιεξυρημένος τὸν πώγωνα Luc. Merc.Cond. 33.
stringor, Gloss.
shavings, scrapings, Sch. Pl. Chrm. 161e.
surgical instrument for scraping or smoothing bones, Heliod. (?)ap. Orib. 46.11.29.

scrape all round, Hp. ap. Gal. 19.130 ; scrape off or away, φλοιόν LXX Wi. 13.11, cf. Gal. 2.653; nibble at, ἄκροισι . . στομάτεσσι δαῖτα Opp. H. 3.525 :— Med., scrape oneself, Diocl. Fr. 141, Alex.Aphr. in Top. 455.25:— Pass., Hp. Mul. 2.192 ; περιξυομένη γῆ drilled out by a borer, Apollod. Poliorc. 149.3.
of great size, bulky, Arist. Phgn. 810b15, Heliod. ap. Orib. 44.8.23.
going round, circuit, Str. 8.6.3, 9.3.1.
patrolling, rounds, Aen.Tact. 1.1 (pl.), al.

children.label: II
children.definition: going through a subject, diligent study, Epicur. Ep. 1p.4U.: pl., ib. p.32 U.; π. φυσική Phld. Rh. 2.53 S.
practice, routine, ἐν π. Gal. 17(1).518; κατὰ τὴν π. ἐν Ῥώμη Id. 14.295.
with circuitous ways, Gloss.
Suid.
traveller, Eust. 1382.59.

children.label: II
children.definition: medical practitioner, Gal. 12.844, Steph. in Hp. 2.457D.

children.label: III
children.definition: visitor of an ecclesiastical foundation, Cod.Just. 1.3.38.2, 1.3.41.19.
of a περιοδευτής : -κά, τά, inspectorʼs report, PLips. 105.16 (i/ii A. D.).
systematic, Dsc. Ther.Praef. (dub.).
making a systematic study of, μαθημάτων Ptol. Tetr. 57.
Placit. 2.4.13.
go all round, τὴν γῆν LXX Za. 1.10 ; τὸν νομόν PCair.Zen. 541.2 (iii B. C.); τὸ Παλάτιον Plu. Cam. 32, cf. Phoc. 21 ; ἐν πάσῃ τῇ γῇ LXX 2 Ki. 24.8; make a revolution, of the moon, Gal. 19.554.
patrol, Aen.Tact. 22.10; π. τὴν πρώτην φυλακήν Id. 26.2; of dyke-watchers, PPetr. 2p.17 (iii B.C.) ; of an inspector, go round vineyards, PCair.Zen. 300.7 (iii B.C.); march round, App. BC 1.58, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: go systematically through, βίον τινός Plu. Util. 2.87b; τὸν περὶ τῶν οὐρανίων λόγον Placit. 3 Prooem., cf. Ptol. Tetr. 1 ( Pass.); study diligently, Epicur. Ep. 2p.35U., Demetr.Lac. Herc. 1013.18, 1055.23 ( Pass.), Epict. Ench. 29.3; περιοδευομένη φαντασία Academici ap. Gal. 5.802.

children.label: III
children.definition: circumvent, cheat, J. AJ 17.4.2.

children.label: IV
children.definition: practise, of a midwife, Sor. 1.3; οἱ περιοδεύοντες practitioners, Alex.Trall. 8.2:— Pass., to be treated, ibid., Id. 11.4.

children.label: V
children.definition: write in periods, Demetr. Eloc. 229 ; διαπορητικῶς π. Hermog. Inv. 4.3:— Pass., ἡ περιωδευμένη προφορὰ καὶ γραφή Phld. Rh. 1.158 S.; but τὸ περιωδευμένον path traversed in a circle, expl. of περίοδος, Demetr. Eloc. 11.
to be periodical, esp. in pres. part., π. ἐπιτάσεις καὶ ἀνέσεις Str. 7.2.1 ; of fevers, intermittent, Ph. 2.576, Gal. 10.627.
acquired in oneʼs travels, ἱστορία Ptol. Geog. 1.2.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: periodical, ἀριθμὸς π. σελήνης Plu. An.procr. 2.1018d; ὧραι Vett.Val. 243.13; recurrent, intermittent, νόσοι Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.116 ; ῥίγη, πυρετοί, Dsc. 1.51, 3.81 ; περιστάσεις Ptol. Tetr. 54 ( Comp.); πυρετοῦ λῆψις Tim. Lex. s.v. καταβολή, cf. Harp., Suid., etc. Adv. -κῶς Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.117, Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 10.37.18, Procl. Inst. 199, Aët. 12.21.

children.label: III
children.definition: periodic, κῶλα, συμμετρία, Demetr. Eloc. 13, 16 ; σχῆμα Anon. Fig. p.112S. Adv. -κῶς, συγκεῖσθαι Demetr. Eloc. 33; λέγειν, ἑρμηνεύειν, Hermog. Inv. 4.3, 8.

children.label: IV
children.definition: π. μέτρον, i.e. a hexameter in which dactyls and spondees alternate, Ps.-Plu. Metr. 2.

definition: περιόδιον, τό, Dim. of περίοδος V, Arr. Epict. 2.1.31.

children.definition: walk about, Hp. Prorrh. 2.3.
one who gains victories in all the great games (cf. περίοδος IV. 2), IG 3.809, 5(1).669, al., Ph. 2.438, POxy. 1643.2 (iii A. D.), D.C. 63.8, al.
one who goes the rounds, patrol, Aen.Tact. 22.3, al., Rev.Arch. 1911(2).424 ( Mesembria, i B. C.).
going round, marching round, flank march, τῶν Περσέων ἡ π. Hdt. 7.219, 229 ; π. καὶ κύκλωσις Th. 4.35.
slow walk, Gal. 17(2).99.
passage of fluids, Aret. SD 1.10, cf. Arist. Pr. 870a10.

children.label: II
children.definition: way round, Hdt. 7.223 ; λίμνης Id. 1.185; circumference, circuit, compass, σήματος, τείχεος, ib. 93, 163 : abs., τὴν π. in circumference, Id. 7.109.

children.label: III
children.definition: γῆς π. chart or map of the earth, Id. 4.36, 5.49, Ar. Nu. 206, Arist. Mete. 362b12, Agathem. 1.1 ; αἱ τῆς γῆς π. books of descriptive geography, Arist. Pol. 1262a19, Rh. 1360a34, Mete. 350a16.

children.label: IV
children.definition: going round in a circle, coming round to the starting-point, circuit, ἡ τοῦ τρίποδος π. Plu. Sol. 4.

cycle or period of time, πάσαις ἐτέων π. Pi. N. 11.40; freq. in Pl., ἐν πολλαῖς χρόνου καὶ μακραῖς π. Phd. 107e ; π. χιλιετής Phdr. 249a: abs., R. 546b, Epicur. Ep. 1p.27U. (pl.), etc.; κατὰ φύσιν π. Arist. GA 777b18; of the Great Year of the Stoics, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.189 (pl.); ἐκ περιόδου periodically, in rotation, Heraclid. Pol. 58, Plb. 2.43.1, etc.; ἐν περιόδῳ Plu. Eum. 8 ; esp. the period embracing the four great public games, κατὰ τὰν π. ἑκάσταν IG 9(1).694.31 (Corc.); ἐνίκησε τὴν π. Ath. 10.415a; νικώμενος τὴν π. Arr. Epict. 3.25.5, cf. Poll. 4.89; v. περιοδονίκης.
periodic recurrence, cycle, Isoc. 15.174, Thphr. CP 1.13.1.

children.label: b
children.definition: cycle, roster of public officials, τῇ πρὸ ταύτης π. τῶν μελλόντων λειτουργεῖν POxy. 1119.6 (iii A. D.), cf. 1552.3 (iii A. D.).

data.quote: τῇ πρὸ ταύτης π. τῶν μελλόντων λειτουργεῖν

children.definition: a regular prescribed course of life, ἐν τῇ καθεστηκυίᾳ π. ζῆν to live in the regular course, Pl. R. 407e; αἱ ἰατρικαὶ π. the periodical visits of a regular physician, the doctorʼs rounds, Luc. Gall. 23, cf. Nigr. 22 : hence, medical practice, Heraclas ap. Orib. 48.18.2.

children.label: b
children.definition: the period of menstruation, Arist. GA 738a17.

children.label: c
children.definition: fit of intermittent fever, or the like, Hp. Aph. 4.59 (pl.), D. 9.29; ὁ ἐκ περιόδου πυρετός an intermittent fever, Luc. Philops. 9.
course at dinner, X. Cyr. 2.2.2 ; π. λόγων table-talk, Id. Smp. 4.64.
orbit of a heavenly body, Id. Mem. 4.7.5 ; ἀστέρος κυκλικὴ π. Vett.Val. 94.20; also θεριναὶ π., = τροπαί, Hp. Aër. 19; revolution of a heavenly body, Epicur. Ep. 1p.28U.

children.label: V
children.definition: survey in thought, ἡ ἅμα νοήματι π. τῶν κυριωτάτων ib. p.32U.

children.label: VI
children.definition: period, Thrasymach. ap. Suid. s.v. Θρασύμαχος, etc.; defined as λέξις ἔχουσα ἀρχὴν καὶ τελευτὴν αὐτὴ καθʼ αὑτὴν καὶ μέγεθος εὐσύνοπτον, Arist. Rh. 1409a35, etc.; also in Music and Metric, Heph. Poëm. 3.5, Aristid.Quint. 1.14.

children.label: VII
children.definition: vessel used in iron-founding, Arist. Fr. 261.

children.label: VIII
children.definition: entrance to a temple enclosure, IG ΙΙ(2).158 A 65 ( Delos, iii B. C.).

children.label: IX
children.definition: = Lat. regio, π. Καρίας Maiuri Nuova Silloge 562 ( Cos).
recurrent, Anon.Rhythm. Oxy. 9 iii 20.

definition: περίοιδα, περιήδη, pf. and plpf. (in pres. and impf. sense),

children.definition: know well, c. inf., περίοιδε νοῆσαι Il. 10.247 : c. dat., ἴχνεσι γὰρ περιῄδη for he was very skilled in the tracks, Od. 17.317 : c.acc. rei et gen. pers., know better than others, περίοιδε δίκας ἠδὲ φρόνιν ἄλλων 3.244 (nisi leg. περὶ ( Adv.) οἶδε ( ; βουλῇ περιίδμεναι ἄλλων to be better skilled in counsel than others, Il. 13.728.
swell round about, Hp. Vict. 3.82, Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 6.20.24.
dwell round persons or places, c. acc., Hdt. 1.57, al., X. An. 5.6.16 : abs., Hdt. 5.23, Lys. 7.28:— Pass., to be inhabited all round, κύκλῳ Arist. Mete. 354a4, Scyl. 107, Scymn. 766.
territorium, Gloss.
place around, [ τῷ ἐγκεφάλῳ] τὰς αἰσθήσεις Gal. UP 8.2 (s. v.l.):— Pass., Id. 5.230.
space round a dwelling, Is. Fr. 102, Aristid. Or. 51(27).55.

definition: περιοικίς, ίδος, ἡ, pecul. fem. of περίοικος,

children.definition: dwelling or lying round about, neighbouring, [ πόλιες] Hdt. 1.76, 9.115, cf. X. HG 3.2.23 ; νῆσοι Th. 1.9 ; κῶμαι Plb. 5.8.4, Plu. Cat.Ma. 1.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. (sc. γῆ, χώρα), country round a town, as of Sparta, Th. 3.16 ; of Elis, Id. 2.25.
town of περίοικοι, dependent town, Arist. Pol. 1320b6, Po. 1448a36, Str. 10.2.2, 6.1.6 (v.l. περιοικίας).
build round, αἱμασιάν D. 55.11 ; θριγκούς Poll. 7.120:— Med., π. τεῖχος Id. 1.160.

children.label: II
children.definition: enclose by building round, τὸ χωρίον D. 55.3 ; ὑμᾶς ib. 29 ; αὐλήν UPZ 10.16 (ii B.C.):— Pass., to be built up, walled in, ἐν τῷ ἱερῷ Th. 3.81 ; περιῳκοδομημένα [θηρία] X. Cyr. 1.4.11 ; τὸ περιοικοδομημένον space built round, enclosure, Hdt. 7.60.
wall built round, IG 11(2).161 A 56 ( Delos, iii B.C.): but in pl., surrounding buildings, SIG 685.75 ( Crete, ii B.C.).

definition: περιοικοδόμησις, εως, Dor. ιος, ἡ, = sq., IG 4.823.43 ( Troezen).

children.definition: building round, IG 11(2).161 A 42 ( Delos, iii B.C.), Inscr.Délos 290.188 (iii B.C.).
administer, manage, τὰ περί τινων POxy. 94.13 (i A.D.).

dwelling round, οἱ π. Λίβυες Hdt. 4.159; οἱ π. neighbours, Id. 1.166, 175, Ephipp. 5.6 ; ἡ π. (sc. χώρα) LXX Ge. 19.25 ; τὸ π. τοῦ Ἰορδάνου ib. 3 Ki. 7.33(46); τὰ π. the neighbouring countries, App. Mith. 112, Hdn. 6.2.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: οἱ π. the inhabitants of the towns dependent on Sparta, Hdt. 6.58, 9.11, Th. 1.101, etc.; also in Crete, Arist. Pol. 1271b30 ; at Argos, ib. 1303a8 : hence generally, dependent, subject, περιοίκους τε καὶ οἰκέτας ἔχοντες Pl. R. 547c ; ἐξὸν . . ἅπαντας τοὺς βαρβάρους περιοίκους τῆς Ἑλλάδος καταστῆσαι Isoc. 4.131.

data.quote: ἐξὸν . . ἅπαντας τοὺς βαρβάρους περιοίκους τῆς Ἑλλάδος καταστῆσαι

children.label: III
children.definition: περίοικοι, οἱ, those who live between the same parallels of latitude as ourselves but 180º to the East or West, opp. ἄντοικοι, ἀντίποδες (qq. v.). Gem. 16.1, Cleom. 1.2.
to be carried about, κλείς Men. 343.
of or for carrying about, Phot.
mobile, of warengines, IG 2(2).468.
run round or about, Agathocl. 2.
run aground: metaph., εἰς ἐπιτηδεύσεις χειρίστας π. fall into the worst habits, D.S. 12.12.
Hsch.

slip about. Hp. Art. 47; slip away all round, Id. VM 22. cf. D.H. 14.10 ; ναῦς π. slips off the engine, Plu. Marc. 15 ; τὰ βέλη π. ἀπὸ [τῶν βυρσῶν] glance off them, J. BJ 3.7.10: metaph., ἡδονὴ π. εἰς τὸ σῶμα ( v.l. for δι-) Plu. Suav. 2.1089d : later περιολισθαίνω, metaph., wander, stray from the point, Plot. 2.2.1.
slipping away, in pl., Plu. Cam. 26, Id. Fac.lun. 2.930e ; ῥαμμάτων Antyll. ap. Orib. 45.24.9.
drawing away, evacuation, Archig. ap. Orib. 8.1.1.
revulsion, Philum.ib. 45.29.17.

children.label: II
children.definition: diversion, J. AJ 15.6.6 (pl.).

children.label: III
children.definition: distraction of mind, Simp. in Epict. p.128D.
destroy utterly, ἣν περὶ Ζεὺς ὀλέσει Epigr.Gr. 336 (Alexandria Troas).
providing with eyes, τῆς ψυχῆς Iamb. VP 6.31.
looking quite unripe, dub. in Hp. Epid. 4.30 ( πέρι, ὁ φακώδης Littré).
pare a personʼs nails, γυναῖκα LXX De. 21.12.
enclose, surround, σάρκα (of a nut) περὶ σκύλος αὖον ὀπάζει Nic. Al. 270 ; θνητοὺς . . κακὸν περὶ γῆρας ὀπάζει Id. Th. 356.
to be overlooked or suffered, c. part., οὔ σφι π. Ἑλλὰς ἀπολλυμένη Hdt. 7.168 ; ἡμῖν τοῦτό ἐστι οὐ π., γένος τὸ Εὐρυσθένεος γενέσθαι ἐξίτηλον Id. 5.39.

data.quote: ἡμῖν τοῦτό ἐστι οὐ π., γένος τὸ Εὐρυσθένεος γενέσθαι ἐξίτηλον

children.definition: to be watched or guarded against, Th. 8.48.

children.label: II
children.definition: περιοπτέον one must overlook or suffer, X. Lac. 9.5, Agath. 3.10.
to be seen all round, in a commanding position, ὄρος Str. 8.6.21 ; τόπος Plu. Arat. 53, etc. ; of a person, π. ἐπιστὰς τοῖς σώμασι J. BJ 2.18.4 ; ἐκ περιόπτου D.H. Comp. 23.

children.label: b
children.definition: Subst. περίοπτα, τά, belvederes, Plu. Luc. 39.
conspicuous, Isoc. ap. Poll. 2.58, etc.; βίος D.S. 14.1 ; κάλλεα AP 5.26 ( Rufin.), etc.; ἔργα Plu. Caes. 16. Adv. - τως gloriously, Id. Sull. 21, etc.
one must overlook, suffer, D.S. 20.2.

definition: περιοράω, impf. περιεώρων, Ion. περιώρων Hdt. 3.118: pf. περιεόρᾱκα D. 18.64 ( περιωρακυῖα cod. S), etc.: fut. περιόψομαι Ar. Nu. 124, etc.: aor. 2 περιεῖδον (v. infr.):—

children.definition: look round upon, Arist. Mete. 345b8:— Pass., ib. a28.
take a look round, Thphr. Char. 25.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: look over, overlook, i.e. look on without regarding, allow, suffer:

part., ἢν τούτους περιίδης διαρπάσαντας Hdt. 1.89 ; μὴ περιιδεῖν τὴν ἡγεμονίην αὖτις ἐς Μήδους περιελθοῦσαν Id. 3.65, cf. 2.110, 4.118, Ar. Ach. 167, Ra. 509, Antipho 3.1.2, Th. 1.24 ; ταῦτα περιιδεῖν γιγνόμενα D. 18.63, cf. 21.115 (but with Art., εἰ ὑμᾶς τοὺς ἐναντιουμένους περιίδοιμεν if we should leave you who are opposing us alone, Th. 4.87): with gen. abs., σφετεριζομένων Θηβαίων τὴν Εὔβοιαν οὐ περιείδετε D. 18.99: rarely without part., οὐ περιόψεται μʼ ἄνιππον [ὄντα] Ar. Nu. 124 ; μηδένʼ ἐν συμφορᾷ (sc. ὄντα) τῶν πολιτῶν π. D. 19.230 : simply c. acc. pers., disregard a suppliant, Men. Per. 6, PMagd. 6.11 (iii B. C.), etc.

data.quote: μὴ περιιδεῖν τὴν ἡγεμονίην αὖτις ἐς Μήδους περιελθοῦσαν
σφετεριζομένων Θηβαίων τὴν Εὔβοιαν οὐ περιείδετε

children.definition: inf., περιιδόντες τοὺς Πέρσας ἐσελθεῖν Hdt. 1.191; τοὺς προπόλους . . οὐ περιορᾶν παριέναι Id. 2.63, cf. 1.24, Th. 1.35, etc.; ἀποθανεῖν Porph. Abst. 3.14: with inf. omitted, οὐκ ἄν με περιεῖδες [ποιέειν] Hdt. 3.155; ὁ πυλουρὸς καὶ ὁ ἀγγελιηφόρος οὐ περιώρων [αὐτὸν ἐσιέναι] ib. 118, cf. Th. 1.39, etc.; περιιδεῖν τινα ἐπὶ πράγματι Hyp. Eux. 38 ; ἐάν τʼ οὖν δοῦλον ἐάν τʼ οὖν καὶ ἐλεύθερον περιορᾷ Pl. Lg. 934d ; π. τὴν ὕβριν τινός X. HG 2.1.9: rarely c.gen., π. τῶν ἄλλων Plu. Amat. 2.764d codd.; τοῦ πλείονος βίου Polem. Cyn. 20.

data.quote: ἐάν τʼ οὖν δοῦλον ἐάν τʼ οὖν καὶ ἐλεύθερον περιορᾷ

children.label: III
children.definition: watch closely, observe, περιορώμενοι ὑπὸ τῶν Λακεδαιμονίων Th. 5.31.
wait for, τὸ μέλλον περιιδεῖν Id. 4.71 ; π. εἴ τινες βοηθήσουσιν Isoc. 9.30.

children.label: IV
children.definition: keep watch for or on behalf of, θεοῦ J. AJ 4.2.2.

children.label: V
children.definition: Med., watch the turn of events, Th. 6.93, 103, 7.33 ; π. ὁποτέρων ἡ νίκη ἔσται Id. 4.73.
look round after, watch over, τῆς Μένδης περιορώμενος ib. 124.
consider anxiously, τοὺς πολεμικοὺς κινδύνους Id. 2.43.
very angry or wrathful, Th. 4.130, J. AJ 18.8.1, D.C. 39.19. Adv. -γῶς A. Ag. 216 (lyr., dub., fort. - όργῳ from Adj. περίοργος).
to be very angry, Plb. 4.4.7.
clasp in the arms, περιωργυιωμένοι περιλαβεῖν Ctes. Fr. 57.6.
towards morning: τὸ π. dawn, Th. 2.3, Hdn. 6.9.3, 7.4.5 (v.l. περιόρθριον).

definition: περιόρια, τά, festival in Cyprus, Hsch.

children.definition: mark by boundaries : set a limit, μέχρις οὗ δεῖ ἔχειν . . Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.226d; ἄνευ τοῦ περιορίζοντος without any boundary, ib. QConv. 719e :— Pass., ἡγεμονία τῷ Ὠκεανῷ περιορισθεῖσα Id. Caes. 58 ; τούτῳ διαστήματι περιωρίσθω Luc. Salt. 37.
draw up the description of the boundaries of a property, π. τὴν χώραν OGI 225.30 ( Didyma, iii B. C.):— Pass., ἀπὸ τῶν περιωρισμένων τόπων SIG 1231.9 ( Nicomedia, iii/iv A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: banish, Lat. deportare, ἐν νήσῳ -ορισθείς D.C. 76.5, cf. Just. Nov. 42.3 Intr. ( Pass.).
dislocate, Apollon.Cit. 1 ( Pass.).
anything surrounded by boundaries, enclosed place, Sch. Pi. O. 13.62, Phot. s.v. οὐρούς.

marking out by boundaries, D.H. 8.75, Plu. Num. 16 ; description of the boundaries of a property, OGI 225.31 ( Didyma, iii B. C.), SIG 685.57 ( Crete, ii B.C., pl.); π. τῆς οἰκουμένης description of . . , Scymn. 74.
boundary, Hero Geom. 4.12.
division of a strophe, κατὰ περιορισμοὺς ἀνίσους Heph. Poëm. 6.

children.label: II
children.definition: = Lat. deportatio, Phot., Suid.
serving to determine or define, Ascl. in Metaph. 78.25.
able to enclose or limit, τοῦ ἀσωμάτου οὐδέν ἐστι π. Corp.Herm. 11.18.
bounded, determined, Hsch.
anchor round, blockade, Th. 4.23, 26, Poll. 1.122, D.C. 59.17.
bring round [a ship] to anchor, D. 51.4,7, PCair.Zen. 343.3 (iii B.C.), Plu. Ant. 35:— Med., come to anchor, Th. 3.6.
marked out by boundary-stones, Eust. 1535.49.

dig round, π. λίμνην dig a lake round . . , Hdt. 2.99 ; π. πρὸς τὰς ῥίζας Arist. Pr. 923b10 ; μέχρι τῶν ῥιζῶν Thphr. CP 5.6.3 ; τὴν ῥίζαν J. BJ 7.6.3:— Pass., τάφρου κύκλῳ περιορυχθείσης Pl. Criti. 118c ; ῥίζης -ορυχθείσης Dsc. 1.126.
dig up around, τὰ πλησίον Plu. Rom. 20.
dig out around, τοὺς λίθους Id. Ant. 45.
dance around, Thphr. HP 9.8.8, Luc. Salt. 8: c.acc., Call. Dian. 240 (tm.).
strong-smelling, fragrant, Sch. Ar. Pl. 808.
round the bones, χιτών, ὑμήν, Ruf. Onom. 129, Gal. 2.591 ( περιόστιος and - ειος are ff.ll., 13.415, 4.550).
sniff all round, Aesop. 311.
meddlers, contemptuously of the θεουργοί II, Aug. Civ.D. 10.16.

that which is over and above, surplus, abundance, ἐρίων Ar. Nu. 50 ; νεῶν Th. 3.13 ; χρημάτων Id. 1.2, 2.13 ; οὔτε σοφίας ἐνδείᾳ οὔτʼ αἰσχύνης π. Pl. Grg. 487e; τοσαύτῃ π. χρήσασθαι πονηρίας D. 19.55; ἂν . . μοι π. ᾖ τοῦ ὕδατος, i.e. time enough for speaking, Id. 59.20.
residuum, Hp. Cord. 11.

children.label: II
children.definition: net gain, profit, ἀπὸ παντὸς π. ποιεῖσθαι Pl. R. 554a ; οὐ γὰρ εἰς π. ἐπράττετʼ αὐτοῖς τὰ τῆς πόλεως so as to bring them advantage, D. 3.26; τῆς ἰδίας τρυφῆς εἵνεκα καὶ π. Id. 21.159, cf. Plb. 4.21.1 ; στρατεία οὐ φέρει περιουσίαν Men. 382: pl., opp. τὰ ἀναγκαῖα, Isoc. 11.15: with Preps., ἀπὸ περιουσίας with plenty of other resources, Th. 5.103; πρὸς περιουσίαν, opp. πρὸς τὰς ἀναγκαίας χρείας, Plb. 4.38.4: most freq. ἐκ π. out of the abundance (of their store), Pl. Tht. 154e, etc.; ἐκ π. χρῆσθαι D.S. 20.59 ; ἐκ π. ζῆν to live on oneʼs own resources, Ath. 4.168a; ἐκ π. κατηγορεῖν τινος at an advantage, D. 18.3 ; also ξενοτροφεῖν ἐκ τῆς π. J. BJ 1.2.5 ; τὰ ἐκ π. superfluities, opp. τὰ ἀναγκαῖα, Arist. Top. 118a6.
superiority of numbers or force, Th. 5.71 ; τοσαύτην ἔχειν π., ὥστε . . D.S. 4.12; π. τῆς δυνάμεως Iamb. Myst. 5.23.

children.label: III
children.definition: survival, τίς οὖν ἡ ταύτης π.; what is its chance of being saved? D. 19.79.

have more than enough, of persons, Phalar. Ep. 81.2, Heraclit. Ep. 8.3 : c. dat., abound in a thing, δυναστείᾳ D.H. 6.75, cf. Crantor ap. S.E. M. 11.58 ; τρυφῇ D.S. 8.18 ; to be abundantly supplied, ὑπό τινος Alciphr. 2.1 :— Med., Corn. ND 15, S.E. M. 1.31, Eust. 33.12.
expend oneʼs means, εἴς τινα Phalar. Ep. 69.2.
speak at unnecessary length, Corn. Rh. p.396 H.

children.label: II
children.definition: abound, τὰ ἐν τᾷ πόλει-άζοντα Hippod. ap. Stob. 4.1.94 ; ὅκα ἐν οἴκῳ καὶ πόλει περιουσιάζῃ whenever there is a surplus, Callicrat. ib. 4.28.16.

children.label: III
children.definition: Act., enrich, τοὺς ἱππέας App. BC 5.9, cf. 75.
Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: private possession, εἰς π. LXX Ps. 134(135).4, cf. Ec. 2.8.
full in treatment, of a treatise, Apollon.Perg. Con. 1 Praef. ( Comp.).
bringing wealth, Ptol. Tetr. 158.
superfluous, Ammon. in APr. 37.9.
having more than enough, wealthy, Hsch.; dub. sens. in PGen. 11.17 (iv A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: especial, peculiar, λαός LXX Ex. 19.5, al., Ep.Tit. 2.14.
round the eye, Gal. 19.436.
to be traversed in all directions, ἡ γῆ . . περιοχουμένη ζῴοις Arist. Mu. 397a25.
a containing, enclosing, Plu. Comm.not. 2.1078b, Herm. ap. Stob. 1.49.69.

compass, circumference, σφαίρας Placit. 3 Prooem., cf. J. BJ 5.4.3, Cleom. 1.11, 2.3, Diog.Oen. 24; opp. μῆκος, BGU 492.10 (ii A.D.); ἡ ἐκτὸς π., of the body, Arist. Col. 797b22, cf. Pr. 870a10, D.S. 1.91 ; κατὰ τὰς τῶν ἐθνῶν π. according to their extent, Id. 17.58 ; mass, body, Plu. Lys. 12 ; π. τις οὐρανοῦ Epicur. Ep. 2p.37U. ; ἀκατάληπτος π., of the world, Secund. Sent. 1.
compass, extent, ἡ π. τῆς ὅλης περιβολῆς καὶ πράξεως Plb. 11.19.2 ; aggregate, Dam. Pr. 88, 95 bis.

data.quote: ἡ π. τῆς ὅλης περιβολῆς καὶ πράξεως

children.label: b
children.definition: content of a definition, etc., Corn. Rh. p.382H., Alex.Aphr. in APr. 278.11, etc.

children.label: c
children.definition: summary, Herm. ap. Stob. 1.41.1 ; σύντομος π. Procl. in Ti. 1.73; periochae, title of summaries of books of Livy.
inclusion, S.E. P. 3.101 ; κατὰ περιοχήν τινος including . . , Ph. 2.488.

children.label: II
children.definition: portion circumscribed or marked off, section of a book, Cic. Att. 13.25.3, Act.Ap. 8.32.

children.label: III
children.definition: pod, husk, shell, Thphr. CP 1.19.2.
fence, fortification, LXX 1 Ki. 22.4, al. ; πόλις περιοχῆς ib. Ps. 30(31).21, al.

children.label: IV
children.definition: straitness, = θλῖψις, συνοχή, Phot.; esp. siege, LXX Je. 19.9 ; ἦλθεν πόλις ἐν περιοχῇ ib. 4 Ki. 24.10; ὕδωρ περιοχῆς ib. Na. 3.14.

children.label: V
children.definition: περιπέτεια, Phot.
superior, Sapph. 92: Boeot. πέροχος, pre-eminent, restd. in Corinn. 2.68.
arrogance, Nic.Dam. 130.29 J. ( ὑπεροψίᾳ cj. Dind.).
Tim. Lex., EM 752.47.
to be in a state of violent emotion or indignation, Conon 38.3, Plu. Superst. 2.168d, etc.; π. εἰ . . Ph. 2.176, etc.
deeply moved, τῇ συμφορᾷ Plb. 1.81.1 ; ἔρωτι Plu. Art. 27 ; χαρᾷ καὶ δέει J. AJ 15.2.7 ; π. τοῖς ὄψοις eager for . . , Phan.Hist. 13 ; π. ταῖς ψυχαῖς in spirit, Plb. 4.54.3 : abs., Plu. Cim. 8.

passionate, ῥήτορες Longin. 8.3 ; σὺν οἰμωγῇ π. Luc. Hist.Conscr. 26 : Comp., ἑταίρα τῶν ἐν τοῖς μίμοις -εστέρα Ael. Fr. 123: Sup., ὅρκος -έστατος Sch.Par. A.R. 2.257. Adv. -θῶς LXX 4 Ma. 8.2, Luc. Tim. 46; ἐπιδραμεῖν Ael. NA 9.8: Comp. - έστερον, λέγειν Plu. Cohib. 2.456a.
pathetic, heartrending, D.C. 40.41; λόγος Id. 76.9 ( Sup.).
intensity of emotion, Ph. 2.26: pl., expressions of emotion in Rhetoric, Ic. 1.158.
look wildly round, Q.S. 13.72.
strike on all sides, EM 288.54.
collision, combination of atoms, Democr. ap. Simp. in Cael. 609.25 (v.l.), prob. in Arist. Cael. 303a8, Thphr. Sens. 66.
to be hurled about, of atoms, cj. for περιπαλαίσεσθαι in Democr. 168 and for περιπλάττεσθαι in Thphr. Sens. 66 : περιπαλαχθῆναι· περιπλακῆναι, Hsch.
tremble all round, Q.S. 10.371, 14.44 ; περιπάλλετο δʼ ἐν φρεσὶ θάμβος Hymn.Is. 156.

definition: περίπαμπαν, Adv., strengthd. for πάμπαν, Opp. C. 2.348 (better divisim).

children.definition: beam all around, D.P. 530.
look timidly round, ἔνθα καὶ ἔνθα Mosch. 4.108 (tm.): c. acc., πέλαγος π. Arat. 297.

strew, sprinkle all round, ὀρίγανον Sotad.Com. 1.28 ; τενθίδας ἡδύσμασι Alex. 84.4 ; ἄλευρον π. αὐτῷ πρὸς τὴν πῆξιν Thphr. HP 9.1.7, cf. Arist. Mir. 845a32 :— Pass., to be sprinkled, ὑπʼ ὀριγάνου Id. HA 534b22 ; τινι with a thing, Gal. 6.533.

data.quote: ἄλευρον π. αὐτῷ πρὸς τὴν πῆξιν

children.definition: sprinkled over, Hp. Int. 51, Archestr. Fr. 18.3.

walk up and down, as in a cloister, opp. βαδίζειν (take a walk), ἐν ταῖς στοαῖς Dicaearch. ap. Plu. An seni 2.796d ; walk about, Ar. Eq. 744, V. 237 ; περιπατῶν ἀνδριάς Alex. 204 ; ἐν τῷ καταστέγῳ δρόμῳ Pl. Euthd. 273a ; π. ἄνω κάτω Ar. Lys. 709 ; π. περιπάτους X. Mem. 3.13.5, cf. Men. Pk. 156 ; περιπατεῖται ἡ ὁδός the road is for walking on, A.D. Synt. 279.19 : c. acc., traverse, ὅλην τὴν Αἴγυπτον POxy. 471.124 (ii A.D.).
walk about while teaching, discourse, Pl. Ep. 348c, D.L. 7.109 ; π. ἐς τοὺς ἀκροωμένους dispute, argue with them, Philostr. VA 1.17, cf. 7.22.
walk, i.e. live, Phld. Lib. p.12 O. ; κατὰ τὴν παράδοσιν Ev.Marc. 7.5 ; ἀτάκτως 2 Ep.Thess. 3.6.
Hsch.
walking about, A.D. Synt. 19.10, Sor. 1.112 tit., S.E. M. 1.74, D.L. 7.98.
one who walks about, Gloss.
of walking, δύναμις Alex.Aphr. de An. 110.31.

children.label: II
children.definition: given to walking about, esp. while teaching or disputing : of Aristotle and his followers (cf. περίπατος II 3), Supp.Epigr. 1.368.5 ( Samos, iii/ii B.C.), Demetr.Lac. Herc. 1055.19, Phld. Acad.Ind. p.112 M., Cic. Acad.Post. 1.4.17, Ceb. 13 ( -πατικοί is f.l.), Plu. Col. 2.1115a, Luc. Herm. 14, CIG 4814c Add. ( Egypt) ; τὰ π. their doctrines, Posidon. 36 J., Cic. Att. 13.19.4 ; ἡ π. φιλοσοφία S.E. M. 11.179.

walking about, walk, ποιεῖσθαι τοὺς π. Pl. Phdr. 227a ; εἰς π. ἰέναι ib. 228b ; ἐξανίστασθαι εἰς π. X. Smp. 9.1 ; ἐν π. εἶναι Id. An. 2.4.15 : metaph., exercise, γλώσσης π. ἐστιν ἀδολεσχία Astyd. 7 ; ψυχῆς π. φροντὶς ἀνθρώποισιν Hp. Epid. 6.5.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: place for walking, esp. covered walk, X. Mem. 1.1.10, Plu. Luc. 39, IG 2(2).2639; Ἀριστοτέλους . . ὑποσκίους περιπάτους Plu. Alex. 7; cf. infr. 2, 3.
discourse during a walk, discussion, argument, Ar. Ra. 942, Bato 2.3 ; π. περί τινος Ar. Ra. 953 ; ἑωθινὸς π., δειλινὸς π., Aristotleʼs names for his morning and evening lectures, Gell. 20.5.5.

school of philosophy, first used of the Academy, ἀναπεπταμένου τοῦ Πλάτωνος π. Epicur. Fr. 171 ; ἔτη ὀκτὼ κατασχὼν τὸν π. (sc. Σπεύσιππος) Phld. Acad.Ind. p.38 M.; οἱ ἀπὸ τοῦ Π., name given to Xenocrates and Aristotle, because their teacher Plato was accustomed to walk about while teaching, Ammon. in Cat. 3.8 ; οἱ ἐκ τοῦ π. the school of Aristotle, Luc. Pisc. 43 ; οἱ ἐκ τῶν π. Str. 13.1.54 ; οἱ ἀπὸ τοῦ π. φιλόσοφοι Plu. Mus. 2.1131f ; τοῦ Π. προστάς Antig.Car. ap. Ath. 12.547d : generally, any school of philosophy, ἕτερος π. Phld. Acad.Ind. p.39 M.; αὐτὸς ἴδιον π. κατασκευάσας ib. p.79 M., cf. p.53M. (pl.); οἱ τὸν αὐτὸν Ἀριστοτέλει ἐμβαίνοντες π. Diog.Oen. 4.

children.label: III
children.definition: progression along the Zodiac in order to determine κλῆροι, Vett.Val. 205.10, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(1).245, al.
become quite quiet, Ach.Tat. 3.5.
to be congealed all round, Orph. L. 526.

definition: περιπεζία ταπείνωσις, Hsch. ; cf. sq. [περιπέζιος] II.1.

children.definition: round the foot: περιπέζια, τά, ornaments for the feet, anklets, Poll. 5.99 ; so περι-πεζίδες, αἱ, ibid.; περί-πεζα, τά, Id. 7.62.
lowly, ‘earthy’, δυνάμυεις Herm. in Phdr. p.102 A., p.128 A., Procl. in Cra. p.69 P., etc. ; μέρος ψυχῆς Simp. in Epict. p.126 D. Adv. -ζίως, εἰπεῖν in common language, Eust. 899.56.
accessible, intelligible, Zonar.

put on a spit, π. τι περὶ λόγχην Plu. Galb. 27 : metaph., pierce, ἑαυτοὺς π. ὀδύναις 1 Ep.Ti. 6.10 :— Pass., to be spitted or pierced, ξίφεσι καὶ λόγχαις D.S. 16.80 ; Χάρακι Id. 19.84; σκόλοπι Ael. NA 7.48; ὀβελοῖς Luc. Gall. 2 : metaph., to become entangled, δυσαναπορεύτοις βαράθροις περιπαρέντες Ph. 1.672 ; δίκτυα, οἷς ἀνάγκη περιπείρεσθαι Id. 2.411, cf. Vett.Val. 250.11.

children.label: II
children.definition: run into, τοὺς ὀδόντας τῇ δειρῇ Lib. Descr. 12.2 ( Pass.):— Pass., ἄγκιστρα περιπαρέντα τοῖς ἰχθύσι Ael. NA 15.10.

definition: περιπέλομαι, Hom. only in Ep. aor. 2 part. περιπλόμενος (the true pres. being περιτέλλομαι, q.v.):

children.label: I
children.definition: move round, be round about, only in part.,
ἄστυ περιπλομένων δηΐων the enemy who have surrounded the town, Il. 18.220, cf. A.R. 3.1150 ; of things, μίτρα μαστοῖς σφιγκτὰ περιπλομένα AP 6.272 ( Pers.).

περιπλομένου δʼ ἐνιαυτοῦ when the year has gone round, Od. 11.248, cf. Hes. Op. 386 ; περιπλομένων ἐνιαυτῶν Od. 1.16, Hes. Th. 184 ; πέντε π. ἐνιαυτούς for five revolved, i.e. complete, years, Il. 23.833.

children.label: II
children.definition: surpass, conquer, οὐδὲ δίκῃ περιέπλεο νῆϊν ἐόντα A.R. 3.130.
sent round about, περίπεμπτα θυοσκεῖς A. Ag. 87 (anap.).
send round from one place to another, [νέας] π. ἔξωθεν Σκιάθου Hdt. 8.7 ; δύο τέλη τῶν ἱππέων Th. 4.86 ; αἱ νῆες . . αἱ ἐς τὸν λιμένα περιπεμφθεῖσαι Id. 5.3.

data.quote: αἱ νῆες . . αἱ ἐς τὸν λιμένα περιπεμφθεῖσαι

children.definition: send round to a number of places, οἱ περιπεμφθέντες Hdt. 1.48.
sending round, dub. in D.C. 56.14.
Opp. H. 2.376; on σπειρηδόν, Suid.
cooked up, Hsch.; cf.sq.

bake a crust round : only metaph., disguise, ὀνόματι π. τὴν μοχθηρίαν Ar. Pl. 159 ; π. αὑτὰς προσθέτοις deck themselves out. with false hair, Id. Fr. 321 ; πεπλασμένως τὸ πρᾶγμα π. Bato 7.6 ; π. ἀβλαβῶς cover Marius without hurting him, Plu. Mar. 37 ( -πεσεῖν codd.) :— Pass., [ἄνδρες] χλανίσι περιπεπεμμένοι Com.Adesp. 338 ; λόγοισιν εὖ πως εἰς τὸ πιθανὸν περιπεπεμμένα dressed up, Pl. Lg. 886e ; λῦπαι ἡδοναῖς περιπεπεμμέναι X. Oec. 1.20 ; also ῥηματίοις περιπεφθείς cajoled by words, Ar. V. 668.
cover with metal plates, Gloss.

definition: περιπετάννυμι, also περιπεταννύω, X. Oec. 19.18: pf. Pass. - πέπτᾰμαι :—

children.definition: spread or stretch around, χέρα [τινί] E. Hel. 628 (lyr.); κατάδεσμον π. ἥβης spread bathing-drawers over . . , Theopomp.Com. 37 (s. v.l.) ; [ὀθόνιον] τῷ ἀγγείῳ Dsc. 5.75 ; π. φοινικίδας spread them out, Aeschin. 3.76; ἄμπελος . . π. τὰ οἴναρα X. l.c.:— Pass., φορεῖον χρυσοῦν περιπεπετασμένον πορφύραν covered with . . , D.S. 31.8 ; ἀμφὶ δέπας περιπέπταται ὑγρὸς ἄκανθος is spread over it, Theoc. 1.55, cf. A.R. 1.1036 (tm.).
spread round or over, π. φίλημα lewd kiss, Ar. Ach. 1201.

turning right about, reversal of the normal order, Arist. HA 590b13 ; esp. sudden change of condition or fortune, Id. Rh. 1371b10 ; π. τύχης D.S. 8.10 ; mostly from good to bad, Plb. 1.13.11, etc.: less freq. from bad to good, Id. 21.26.16, D.S. 4.43 : generally, any strange occurrence, unexpected event, Plb. 9.12.6, 38.9.2, D.S. 3.57, etc. ; ἐκ π. Arist. Po. 1454b29, cf. Plb. 32.8.4, Sch. BT Il. 2.156.

sudden reversal of circumstances on which the plot in a Tragedy hinges, such as Oedipus’ discovery of his parentage, ἔστι δὲ π. ἡ εἰς τὸ ἐναντίον τῶν πραττομένων μεταβολή Arist. Po. 1452a22, cf. 1450a34 (pl.).

data.quote: ἔστι δὲ π. ἡ εἰς τὸ ἐναντίον τῶν πραττομένων μεταβολή

children.label: b
children.definition: plot itself, = ὑπόθεσις, S.E. M. 3.3.
ἡ π. τοῦ λόγου the varied course of the argument, Olymp. in Mete. 98.12, 274.28 : but in pl., of cheap sensational effects, Phld. Po. 5.33.
falling round, ἀμφὶ μέσσῃ π. προσκείμενος lying with his arms clasped round her waist, S. Ant. 1223.
surrounded by, wrapped in, πέπλοισι A. Ag. 233 (lyr.).
ἔγχος π. the sword round which ( i.e. on which) he has fallen, S. Aj. 907.

children.label: II
children.definition: falling in with, falling into evil, καταστῆσαί τινα δεινῷ μηδενὶ π. D. Ep. 5.1 ; π. γίγνεσθαι, = περιπίπτειν, fall among, τοῖς σταυροῖς καὶ τοῖς ὀρύγμασι Plu. Pomp. 62 ; πολέμοις Id. Cic. 42 : π. εἶναι τῇ χολῇ τινος Luc. Pseudol. 1 ; πόλις αὐτὴ ἑαυτῇ π. γενομένη Plu. Phoc. 33 ; ἀλλήλοις Anon. ap. Suid. ; π. ποιεῖν αὑτοῖς τοὺς πολεμίους cause them to fall foul of each other, Plu. Marc. 26 ; π. τοῖς ἑαυτῶν λόγοις Hermog. Stat. 1 (cf. περιπίπτω II.3) ; π. τῇ αἰτίᾳ γενέσθαι become liable to the charge, Plu. CG 10.

children.label: III
children.definition: changing or turning suddenly, of a manʼs fortunes, esp. from good to bad, περιπετέα ἐποιήσαντο σφίσι . . τὰ πρήγματα a sudden reverse, Hdt. 8.20 ; π. τύχαι E. Andr. 982 ; cf. foreg.
concerned with vicissitudes of fortune, διηγήσεις Corn. Rh. p.363 H.

fly around, Ar. Av. 165 : c. acc., ib. 1721 ; περιεπέτετο τὰ οἰκία Ant.Lib. 16.3 ; π. τὰ πελάγη Luc. Halc. 1 ; τὴν ἑκάστου γνώμην π. Id. Hist.Conscr. 1 : the form περιπέταμαι occurs in codd. of Arist. HA 609a14 ; cf. περιίπταμαι.
to be dashed upon a rock, Hsch.
surrounded by rocks, Hsch.
very sharp, keen, or painful, βέλος Il. 11.845.
very thoughtfully, gloss on περιφραδέως, Hsch.
very cautiously, gloss on ἀνακῶς, Erot. ( περιφυλ- codd.).
congealed around, λιβάνοιο χύσις π. θάμνοις Nic. Al. 107.
frame, Ph. Bel. 78.15, Hero Bel. 82.12.

definition: περιπήγνυμι and περιπηγνύω ( Plu. Def.orac. 2.433b) : also περιπήττω (v. infr.) :—

children.definition: fix round, fence round, c. acc. loci, περὶ δὲ πάξαις Ἄλτιν Pi. O. 10(11).45 ; π. τῷ σώματι χιτῶνα Plu. Sollert. 2.966d :— Pass. with pf. περιπέπηγα, αἷς π. ἡ σαρκώδης οὐσία Gal. 18(2).597 ; περιπησσέσθωσαν σανίδες Apollod. Poliorc. 173.13 ; περιπαγῆναί τινι τὸν αὐχένα to have oneʼs neck fixed in it, Ar. Fr. 301.

data.quote: περιπέπηγα, αἷς π. ἡ σαρκώδης οὐσία

children.definition: make to congeal round, τὴν τέφραν τῷ βωμῷ Plu. Def.orac. 2.433b :— Pass. with pf. intr. -πέπηγα, τὰ ὑποδήματα π. are frozen on the feet, X. An. 4.5.14 ; περιπήττεται τὸ ὕδωρ τινί Str. 12.5.4 ; τὸ δάκρυον [τῆς ἀμπέλου] π. τοῖς στελέχεσι Dsc. 5.1 ; of a coated tongue, Gal. 17(2).277 : metaph., τἀγαθῷ -πεπηγός Dam. Pr. 70.

data.quote: τὸ δάκρυον [τῆς ἀμπέλου] π. τοῖς στελέχεσι

children.definition: leap round or upon, Luc. Anach. 31.
encase in clay, Gal. 12.727, Pholm. 8.34, Olymp.Alch. p.76B.
encasing in clay, Zos.Alch. p.135B.
congealing all round, τῶν ἁλῶν Str. 12.5.4.
take into oneʼs arms, Call. Fr. 344.
make very fertile, D.P. 1071.
squeeze, Heliod. ap. Orib. 50.9.5 ( Pass.).
very harsh or bitter, Phld. Ir. p.6 W., Ptol. Tetr. 160, Procl. Par.Ptol. 225.
cover thick all round, οἶκον χρυσίῳ LXX 3 Ki. 6.20(21).
very fat, Xenocr. ap. Orib. 2.58.11, Poll. 2.233
to be filled full of. λευκότητος περιεπλήσθη Pl. Tht. 156e: abs., περιεπλήσθη ἡ οἰκία X. HG 3.2.28.
set on fire round about: impf. περιεπίμπρα X. Cyn. 10.17 codd.; - επίμπρασαν Th. 3.98:— Pass., aor. περιεπρήσθησαν D.C. 51.24.

definition: περιπιπράσκω, fut. Pass. περιπραθήσεται, expld. by ἀπωνηθήσεται, AB 432 (dub. l.).
περιπίπτω, fut. -πεσοῦμαι Ar. V. 523, etc.: Ep. pf. part. fem. περιπεπτηυῖαι Eratosth. 16.9:—

children.definition: fall around, i.e. so as to embrace, τινι X. An. 1.8.28; ἐπί τινι Plu. Crass. 17; εἰς τὸ στῆθος Id. Sert. 26.
fall around, i.e. upon, a weapon, τῷ ξίφει Ar. V. 523; τῷ βέλει Antipho 3.3.6.
ζῶναι] πόλοις περιπεπτηυῖαι encircling the poles, Eratosth. l.c.
fall over, ἑκατέρωσε Plu. Pyrrh. 24; πλαγία περιπεσοῦσα Id. Ant. 67.

children.label: II
children.definition: fall in with, Hdt. 6.105; ἀλλήλοις X. An. 7.3.38, etc.; freq. of ships meeting at sea, Hdt. 6.41, 8.94, Th. 8.33, 103; π. μουσικῇ τε καὶ ταῖς μέθαις having encountered them in our discussion. Pl. Lg. 682e; ἡ ὄψις κάμνουσα ἐν τοῖς μικροῖς τοῖς μεγάλοις ἀσμένως π. Plot. 6.9.3: abs., supervene, Petos. ap. Vett.Val. 278.8.
fall foul of other ships, τῇσι σφετέρῃσι νηυσί Hdt. 8.89; περὶ ἀλλήλας of one another, ib. 16; also π. περὶ τὴν Σηπιάδα to be wrecked on . . , Id. 7.188.

fall in with, fall into, mostly of evil, c. dat., π. ἀδίκοισι γνώμῃσι fall in with, encounter unjust judgements, Id. 1.96; π. τοιαύτῃσι τύχῃσι, δουλοσύνῃ, Id. 6.16, 106; νούσοις, νοσήμασι, Hp. VM 3, X. Cyr. 6.2.27; λουτροῖσιν ἀλόχου E. Or. 367; αἰσχρᾷ τύχῃ Id. Hec. 498; ἀκουσίοις κακοῖς Antipho 3.3.7; τοιούτῳ πάθει Th. 2.54; τοιαύτῃ συμφορᾷ περιπέπτωκεν ὑπὸ τούτου D. 21.96, cf. And. 1.51; ἀβροχίαις OGI 56.15 ( Canopus, iii B. C.); π. συκοφάνταις Lys. 7.1; αἰσχύνῃ X. HG 7.3.9; ταῖς μεγίσταις ζημίαις Isoc. 7.27, cf. 12.146; αἰτίᾳ Plu. Ant. 67; also σοὶ αὐτῷ περιπίπτειν to be caught in your own snare, Hdt. 1.108, cf. 8.16, Luc. DMort. 8[26].2; τοῖς ἐμαυτοῦ λόγοις περιπίπτω Aeschin. 2.144 : with a Prep., ἐν σφίσι κατὰ τὰς ἰδίας διαφορὰς π. Th. 2.65 : abs., come to grief, Plb. 8.36.4, Vett.Val. 16.2.
befall one, ἤν μοί τι περιπίπτῃ κακόν Ar. Th. 271 : abs., δεῖ τι περιπεσεῖν Philostr. VA 1.33.

children.label: III
children.definition: change suddenly, εἴς τι Plb. 3.4.5.

definition: περιπίτνω, poet. for περιπίπτω, c. acc., καρδίαν π. κρύος

children.definition: comes over or upon the heart, A. Th. 834 (lyr.).
wander about, [ Κρήτην] Hdt. 4.151 : metaph., float round about one, as the lionʼs skin round Heracles, Pi. I. 6(5).47.

wander, Luc. Herm. 59, D.C. 47.21, etc.: metaph., ταῦτα π. to be in this state of uncertainty, X. Cyr. 1.3.5; περιπλανᾶσθαι τὸν αὐλικὸν . . ᾑρημένον βίον Phld. Ind.Sto. 13; περιπεπλανημένα μέτρα erratic, irregular, D.H. Dem. 50.
wandering about, Plu. QPlat. 2.1001e.
wandering about, Plu. Curios. 2.520f (pl.).

definition: περιπλανία, poet. περιπλανίη, ἡ, = foreg., Jahresh. 4 Beibl. 20 ( Tithorea).

children.definition: περιπλανής, βίος AP 7.736 ( Leon.).
plastering round, Gal. 6.690.

plaster one thing over another, form as a mould or cast round, περίπλασον αὐτοῖς εἰκόνα Pl. R. 588d; οἱ πλάττοντες ἐκ πηλοῦ ζῷον ὑφιστᾶσι τῶν στερεῶν τι σωμάτων, εἶθʼ οὕτω περιπλάττουσιν Arist. PA 654b31; τοῦ αἵματος τὸ πηγνύμενον μύρμηκες τοῦ ποδὸς περὶ τὸν μέγαν δάκτυλον περιέπλαττον Plu. Cim. 18; ἡ μύξα περιπλάττεται περί . . Arist. HA 621b8; [ ὁ κηρὸς] -πλάσσεται τοῖς ὀδοῦσι PMed.Lond. 155.2.8; [ κόκκον] ἐν ἄρτῳ περιπλάττοντες kneading it up in . . , Thphr. HP 9.20.2 : metaph., smooth over, disguise, τι χρηστοῖς λόγοις Men. 652; but οἱ [τῷ ζῆν] κενῶς -πλαττόμενοι those who cleave to life, Epicur. Sent.Vat. 47 (= Metrod. Fr. 49).

data.quote: οἱ πλάττοντες ἐκ πηλοῦ ζῷον ὑφιστᾶσι τῶν στερεῶν τι σωμάτων, εἶθʼ οὕτω περιπλάττουσιν
τοῦ αἵματος τὸ πηγνύμενον μύρμηκες τοῦ ποδὸς περὶ τὸν μέγαν δάκτυλον περιέπλαττον

children.definition: plaster over with a thing, περιπλάττεται πηλῷ Arist. Pr. 924b37; περιπεπλασμέναι ψιμυθίοις Eub. 98.1.
surround with a bank of clay, in Pass., Sammelb. 4481.8 (v A. D.).
rattle all round, Q.S. 7.500.
closely entwined, Eratosth. 27; π. ἔχειν τινά in close embrace, AP 5.258 ( Paul.Sil.), cf. 254.16 ( Id.), Opp. H. 2.376; of ivy, Luc. Am. 12, etc.
intricacy, μαθημάτων Iamb. Protr. 21.καʹ.
one must mix, μέλιταῖς τροφαῖς Aët. 4.20.
embracing, τινος Gal. 19.131.
intertwining, crossing, of the feet of dancers, Theoc. 18.8 (nisi leg. περίπλικτος).

definition: περιπλέκω, aor. 2 part. Pass. περιπλεκείς Tim. Pers. 157:—

children.definition: twine or fold round, π. τινὶ τὰ σκέλη περὶ τὴν γαστέρα Luc. Anach. 31; embrace, ταῖς χερσὶν τοὺς πόδας τινός D.H. 8.54; τινα Call. Epigr. 45 :— Med., hug one another, Luc. Anach. 1 :—used by Hom. only in Pass., fold oneself round, embrace, c. dat., [ ἱστῷ] περιπλεχθείς Od. 14.313; γρηῒ περιπλέχθη 23.33; περιπλάκηθι τῷ λοιπῷ πατρί E. Fr. 930; ἀμφὶ γόνασι π. Tim. l.c.; περιπλέκονται ἀλλήλοις οἱ ὄφεις Arist. GA 718a27, cf. HA 550a12; δεσμὰ π. τινί Luc. DDeor. 21[17].1 : abs., [ δίκτυον] εὖ μάλα περιπλεκόμενον close folding, X. Mem. 3.11.10; τὰ στοιχεῖα . . περιπλεκόμενα γεννᾶν Arist. GC 325a34 (also c. acc. cogn., περιπλέκεσθαι περιπλοκήν, of atoms, Id. Fr. 208); περιπλακεῖσα συκῆ Thphr. CP 5.5.3: metaph., embrace an idea, Iamb. VP 35.258 (s. v.l.).

data.quote: π. τινὶ τὰ σκέλη περὶ τὴν γαστέρα

children.definition: twine round with something, τὰ νέα φυτά Thphr. CP 5.15.6.
mix drugs, Philum. ap. Aët. 5.78 ( Act. and Pass.).

children.label: II
children.definition: complicate, entangle, τὸν λόγον Luc. Herm. 81, cf. Gal. 5.339; περιπεπλεγμένον intricate, involved, Pl. Plt. 265c; περιπεπλ. φιλία, of a flatterer, Plu. Adul. 2.62d.

wrap up in words, i. e. in circumlocutory and indirect phrases, αἰσχυνόμενος δὲ π. τὴν συμφοράν Com.Adesp. 576; οὐκ οἶδʼ ὅπως δυνήσομαι π. Aeschin. 1.52; ἐμπλέκοντες καὶ περιπλέκοντες καὶ οὐθὲν βουλόμενοι λέγειν ἐφεξῆς D.Chr. 11.24; σαφῶς, μηδὲν περιπλέκων Gal. 8.948, cf. Arr. Epict. 2.19.27, Hermog. Meth. 8, D.C. 63.20.

data.quote: ἐμπλέκοντες καὶ περιπλέκοντες καὶ οὐθὲν βουλόμενοι λέγειν ἐφεξῆς

children.definition: Arist. Cael. 303a8 (v.l. ἐπαλλάξει; περιπαλάξει cj. Diels).

definition: περιπλευμονία or περιπνευμονία (both forms freq. in codd.), Ion. -ιη, ἡ, ( πλεύμων)

children.definition: inflammation of the lungs, Hp. VM 17 (pl.), Aph. 3.23 (pl.), al., Pl. La. 192e, Hipparch. ap. Stob. 4.44.81 (= Com.Adesp. 344, pl.), Aret. SA 2.1, Luc. Merc.Cond. 31, Gal. 19.419.
have περιπλευμονία, Poll. 4.187 (in form περιπν-).
affected with περιπλευμονία, Hp. Prog. 3, al., Dsc. 3.25; π. πάθη Plu. QConv. 2.699e. Adv. -κῶς Hp. Coac. 67.
embrace, Phryn. PS p.99 B.
affecting the πλευρά, νοσήματα Hp. Coac. 502 (v.l. for πλευριτικά).
covering the sides, κύτος E. El. 472 (lyr.).

sail or swim round, abs., Hdt. 6.44, Ephipp. 5.16 (anap.), etc.; float, of an island, Hecat. 305J.: c. acc., Λιβύην, Πελοπόννησον, τὴν ἄκρην, τὴν Εὔβοιαν, Hdt. 4.42, 179, 5.108, 8.14; π. αὐτοὺς κύκλῳ Th. 2.84; ἀνὴρ πολλὰ περιπεπλευκώς Ar. Ra. 535; π. ἐκ τοῦ Κωρύκου Th. 8.34; ἀπʼ Ἰωνίας εἰς Κιλικίαν X. An. 1.2.21, cf. Th. 8.92; εἰς Πύλας D. 18.32; π. ἐκεῖσε X. HG 1.1.11.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be unstable, slip about, Hp. Fract. 4.
recur, ἐς περίοδον π., of a headache, Aret. SD 1.2.

children.label: III
children.definition: Pass., to be wrapped up, Heliod. ap. Orib. 44.23.20.

definition: περίπλεως, ων, pl. περίπλεῳ, neut. - πλεα, -ω (Xen.): also περίπλεος, (-α) -ον, Arist. Phgn. 810a32, A. R. 1.858; poet. περίπλειος Arat. 1118:— c. gen.,

children.definition: quite full of a thing, Th. 4.13, Arist. HA 585a24, etc.; μυκηθμοῖο π. βόες Arat. l.c.; ψυχὴ π. σώματος soul burdened with body, Plu. Rom. 28 : c. dat., filled with a thing, A.R. l.c., Dsc. 3.4, AP 6.28 ( Jul.Aegypt.).

children.label: II
children.definition: supernumerary, spare, ἔχειν ξύλα περίπλεα καὶ ἅρμασι καὶ ἁμάξαις X. Cyr. 6.2.33.

data.quote: ἔχειν ξύλα περίπλεα καὶ ἅρμασι καὶ ἁμάξαις

children.definition: full, large, νεφροί Arist. PA 672a27 ; κνῆμαι Id. Phgn. l.c.
very full of people, νῆσος Od. 15.405 ; of a speech, full of matter, Plu. Cat.Mi. 5.
very full or large, σάρξ Id. Mar. 34, cf. Luc. Anach. 25: Comp. - έστερος Id. VH 2.40.

children.label: II
children.definition: very full of a thing, c. gen., καρπῶν Ph. 2.494 ( Sup.); σπέρματος Dsc. 3.23 : c. dat., Opp. H. 1.796, al.
to be quite full, c. gen., πόλις νεκρῶν περιπλήθουσα, γαῖα ν. περιπεπληθυῖα, Tryph. 595, Q.S. 11.160 : also c. dat., βουκολίοισι Theoc. 25.13; σαρκί Opp. H. 5.591 :— Med., abs., ib. 678.
crossing, ποσσὶ π., of dancers, Theoc. 18.8 ( v.l. - πλέκτοις).
embracing with the legs, Hsch.
put the legs round or across, τὰ θυγάτρια περὶ τὴν λεκάνην . . περιπεπλιγμένα Stratt. 63, cf. Eust. 1564.49, Hsch.

data.quote: τὰ θυγάτρια περὶ τὴν λεκάνην . . περιπεπλιγμένα

children.definition: AP 5.251 ( Paul.Sil.).
capreolus, cincinnus, Gloss. (pl.).
twining round, interlacing, Arist. HA 540b4; περιπλοκαὶ γυναικῶν Plb. 2.56.7, cf. Luc. Alex. 39, etc.; περιπλοκῆς δεῖται [ὁ κιττός] Plu. QConv. 2.649c.

children.label: b
children.definition: interlacing of atoms, Ep. 1p.8U., 2p.44U. (pl.), al.; περιπλοκὴν περιπλέκεσθαι Arist. Fr. 208.
entanglement, complication, POxy. 533.10 (ii/iii A. D.).
intricacy, περιπλοκὰς λόγων circumlocutions, E. Ph. 494, cf. Hermog. Meth. 8; περιπλοκὰς λίαν ἐρωτᾷς Antiph. 74.1; τί οὖν . . π. λέγεις; Strato Com. 1.35; χωρὶς -πλοκῆς λέγειν τἀληθῆ M.Ant. 12.1.
entwined, δεσμῷ AP 9.362; σειρῇσι Tryph. 300; coiled, of a snake, Nonn. D. 22.34 : c. dat., twined about, ὅρμος π. αὐχένι ib. 6.195.
sailing round, ἡγητὴρ π. AP 9.559 ( Crin.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., that may be sailed round, π. ἐστὶν ἡ γῆ Th. 2.97; κολωνός Philostr. Im. 2.17.

children.label: III
children.definition: τὸν Ἰσθμὸν περίπλουν ἐργαζόμενος making it a passage by water, Id. VA 4.24.

children.label: IV
children.definition: enfolding, σὺν λοβοῖς πολλάκις κοίλῃ περιπλόοις enfolding the vena cava, Hp. Ep. 23.

definition: περίπλοος, ον, contr. περίπλους, gen. πλου, nom. pl. - πλοι :—

children.definition: circumnavigation, c. gen., τὸν π. τοῦ Ἄθω Hdt. 6.95; περὶ Πελοπόννησον Th. 2.80, cf. 8.4; τὸν π. τὸν εἰς Κέρκυραν Aeschin. 3.243; esp. round the enemyʼs fleet, X. HG 1.6.31 : metaph., of a journey by land, Call. Fr. 278; of the journey of the soul in transmigration, Diog.Oen. 35.

children.label: II
children.definition: account of a coasting voyage (opp. περίοδος of a land-journey), γράφειν τὸν π. τῆς ἔξω θαλάσσης Luc. Hist.Conscr. 31: Periplus is the title of several geograph. works, still extant, by Scylax, Agatharchides, Arrian, etc.

data.quote: γράφειν τὸν π. τῆς ἔξω θαλάσσης

children.definition: very rich, Sch. Opp. H. 3.221.
soluble portion, ἡ κονία π. τῆς τέφρας Gal. 12.35.
wash clean, scour, D. 54.9, Plu. Adul. 2.69c; ὀπόν Diocl. Fr. 141, etc.:— Pass., have a thing washed off one, Arist. HA 591a28; also of the thing, ὅταν ἡ ἅλμη περιπλυθῇ Thphr. CP 4.14.4.
thin discharge from the bowels, Hp. Coac. 600; π. κοιλίης Id. Prorrh. 1.2, Aret. SA 1.5.

definition: περιπλώω, Ion. and poet. for περιπλέω.

children.definition: breathe round, c. acc., Μακάρων νᾶσον αὖραι περιπνέοισι Pi. O. 2.72, cf. Luc. VH 2.5: abs., D.S. 3.19:— Pass., ἡ γῆ περιπνεομένη αὔραις Arist. Mu. 397a34; οἴκησις περιπνεομένα ( Dor.) Myia Ep. 4.

children.label: II
children.definition: exhale a scent of, οἰκία περιπνεῖ Ἐρμοῦ καὶ Μουσῶν Eun. VS p.483 B.
asphyxiation, Vett.Val. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(1).168 (pl.).
suffocated, choked, Nic. Th. 432, J. AJ 7.13.3 ; ὑπὸ τοῦ θυμοῦ Agatharch. 76 ; τῇ τῆς ἀναπνοῆς φθορᾷ D.S. 38.4 :—also περί-πνῑγος, ον, Sch. Nic. Th. 432.
suffocate, Gp. 6.1.2 ( Pass.).
blowing round about, ἀνέμων D.S. 3.19 (pl.), cf. Serv. ad Verg. A. 5.772 (pl., in form περι-πνοία).
ventilation, Gal. 7.393 (pl.).
blown round about, airy, ἐν περίπνῳ [εἶναι] Thphr. HP 5.1.11.
going round the feet, σύρμα Ptol. Alm. 8.1, cf. AB 354.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. περιπόδιον, τό, part about the feet, Ptol. Alm. 7.5; περιποδίη ( Ion.), ἡ, foot-bandage, Hp. ap. Gal. 19.130.
much-beloved, J. AJ 16.11.8, Luc. Tim. 12, DMort. 19[9].2, Chor. Proc. 8: Comp., App. BC 3.4; π. ταλαιπώρημα Secund. Sent. 9.
cause to remain over and above, keep safe, preserve, Hdt. 3.36, al., Th. 2.25, al., Lys. 13.63, etc.; ἐκ κακῶν καὶ πολέμου ὑμᾶς αὐτοὺς π. Id. 6.47.
save up, lay by, X. Oec. 11.10 ; ἀπʼ ὀλίγων ib. 2.10 ; τῶν προσόδων part of the revenues, Is. 6.38, cf. POxy. 2148.17 (i A. D.).
obtain a net product or residue, Thphr. Lap. 58.

procure, secure, achieve, lay up, αἰσχύνην τῇ πόλει Isoc. 15.301 ; π. τῇ πόλει τὰ εἰς τιμὴν ἀνήκοντα Milet. 3 No.146.84 (iii B. C.); πολλὰ καὶ μεγάλα τῶν συμφερόντων τῇ πατρίδι IGRom. 4.1757 ( Sardes, i B. C.); δυναστείας ἑαυτοῖς Aeschin. 3.3 ( Med.), cf. D. 15.11; τὰ πράγματα ἐς ἑαυτοὺς π. get things into their own hands, Th. 8.48, cf. Is. 7.6.

data.quote: π. τῇ πόλει τὰ εἰς τιμὴν ἀνήκοντα
πολλὰ καὶ μεγάλα τῶν συμφερόντων τῇ πατρίδι

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., keep or save for oneself, [ τὸ παιδίον] Hdt. 1.110 (sed leg. - ποιήσῃς) τὸ ζῆν Arist. Pol. 1315a26; ἐλπίδας ἑαυτῷ D. 19.240; compass, acquire, gain possession of, δύναμιν, ἰσχύν, Th. 1.9, 15 ; ἑαυτῷ ὄνομα καὶ δύναμιν π. X. An. 5.6.17, cf. LXX 1 Ma. 6.44; παρὰ τοῦ πλήθους δόξαν D. 12.19; αὑτοῖς δυναστείαν Arist. Pol. 1306a24; πρόβατα PMich.Zen. 87.7 (iii B. C.); [ ἐκκλησίαν] διὰ τοῦ αἵματος Act.Ap. 20.28; save, τοσαῦτα ὥστε καὶ πλουτεῖν X. Mem. 2.7.3; χρυσίον LXX 1 Ch. 29.3 ; make gain, ἀπό τινος X. Mem. 4.2.38 :— Pass., χρήματα περιποιηθησόμενα Cod.Just. 1.4.26 Intr.
Act. 1.1, freq. in LXX, as Ge. 12.12, al.
acquisition, Vett.Val. 90.7.
keeping safe, preservation, Pl. Def. 415c, LXX 2 Ch. 14.13(12), Ma. 3.17, Ep.Hebr. 10.39.
those who are saved, Ep.Eph. 1.14.

children.label: II
children.definition: gaining possession of, acquisition, 1 Ep.Thess. 5.9, 2 Ep.Thess. 2.14, PTeb. 317.26 (ii A. D.), Vett.Val. 85.16, Just. Edict. 13.15 ; procuring, A.D. Synt. 294.9.
λαὸς εἰς περιποίησιν, = λ. περιούσιος, 1 Ep.Pet. 2.9.

able to procure, productive, c. gen., πνευμάτων Mnesith.Ath. ap. Ath. 8.357f; ζημίας καὶ ὠφελείας Ph. 1.463; εὐχροίας Dsc. 2.104; πειθοῦς S.E. M. 2.9, etc.; expld. by διοικητής, Hsch. Adv. περιποιητικῶς Sch. Ar. Pl. 717.
grasping, αὑτῷ τοῦ πλείονος Arr. Epict. 4.7.11.
indicating the procuring of, ἐνεργειῶν A.D. Synt. 297.27.
wealth-bringing, τόπος Nech. ap. Vett.Val. 291.15.
abundantly produced, Hsch. s.v. περιούσιον.
to be variegated, Apollon. Lex. s.v. κεστός.
variegated, spotted, οὐρά X. Cyn. 5.23, cf. IG 2(2).1514.8.
busy oneself with, Q.S. 4.210 :— Med., Opp. H. 2.615 (divisim edd.).

definition: περιπολάζω, f.l. for ἐπι-, Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.587b.

children.definition: open all round, flat, of eyes, Arist. Phgn. 810a1 ( Comp., nisi leg. ἐπι-, cf. foreg.).

definition: περιπολάρχης ( Hsch. s.v. κωδωνοφορῶν) or περιπόλ-αρχος ( IG 2(2).204.20, 1193, 2.1219, 1219b), ου, ὁ, ( περίπολος)

children.definition: commander of military patrol, Th. 8.92, IG and Hsch.ll.cc.
[Ἥλιον] περιπολεύοντα τὸν κόσμον Phylarch. 25 J. (v.l.); ἄλγη περιπολεύοντα Sch. Nic. Al. 339.

go round or about, wander about, S. OT 1254; καθ; Ἑλλάδα E. IT 84, 1455 ; μετά τινος Pl. Phdr. 252c ; ἡ στρατιὰ ἡ μετὰ βασιλέως περιπολοῦσα Isoc. 4.145 ; of the sun or stars, Pl. Ti. 41a, Arist. Fr. 10, Epicur. Ep. 2p.52U.: aor. Pass. in med. sense, D.L. 8.4.

data.quote: ἡ στρατιὰ ἡ μετὰ βασιλέως περιπολοῦσα

children.label: II
children.definition: traverse, οὐρανόν Pl. Phdr. 246b ; τόνδε τὸν τόπον Id. Tht. 176a ; π. στρατόν prowl about it, E. Rh. 773 ; ἔρως ὁ τὰς πόλεις π. Philostr. Ep. 5, etc.
οἱ ταχθέντες . . περιπιπολεῖν τὴν χώραν to patrol the country, X. Vect. 4.52 ; οἱ ἔφηβοι . . π. τὴν χώραν Arist. Ath. 42.4, cf. IG 1(2).99.22 (prob.).

definition: περιπόλημα, ατος, τό, Astron., = sq., π. κοσμικόν Vett.Val. 259.20.

children.definition: revolution, of the stars, Ph. 1.10 (pl.); τῶν οὐρανίων Theo Sm. p.120 H., cf. lamb. VP 15.65; τὴν π. ποιεῖσθαι, of the sun, Porph. ap. Eus. PE 3.12; π. τῆς ψυχῆς, of metempsychosis, Max.Tyr. 38.3, D.L. 8.4.
wander about, Str. 14.5.15 ; move in society, PMed. in Arch.Pap. 4.270 (iii A. D.).
station for περίπολοι, guard-house, fort, SIG 38.17 ( Teos, v B. C.), Th. 3.99, 6.45, 7.48, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: suburb or township, LXX 1 Ch. 6.71 (56), IG 12(1).1033 ( Carpathos), etc.; τὸ π. τῆς θεοῦ the quarter round her temple, CIG 2715.16 ( Lagina).
lying round a place, c. gen., κατοικίαι π. τῆς Νικοπόλεως Str. 7.7.6, cf. 14.2.22, 17.3.21.
street-walker, vagrant, Phryn.Com. 33.
Vett.Val. 331.20.
disposed for wandering : hence σύνοδος π. a company of travelling artistes, IG 2(2).1350, 14.747 ( Naples), IGRom. 4.1361 ( Thyatira), etc.
very much, A.R. 2.437.
going the rounds, patrolling: hence, as Subst.,
watchman, patrol, Epich. 35.10, Plu. Num. 16, Luc. VH 2.6, etc.; π. τῶν βασιλείων Lib. Or. 59.144.
patrol, in which ἔφηβοι (and also non-Athenians, cf. Lys. 13.71 with Th. 8.92) served, Ar. Av. 1177, Th. 4.67, 8.92; τοὺς π. ἀπιένʼ εἰς τὰ φρούρια Eup. 341 : sg. in Aeschin. 2.167.

data.quote: τοὺς π. ἀπιένʼ εἰς τὰ φρούρια

children.definition: attendant, follower, as fem., S. Ant. 1150 (lyr.).
π. πάσης τῆς ὑφʼ ἥλιον ‘globe-trotter’, Him. Or. 14.25, cf. Lib. Ep. 168.
περίπολος (sc. ναῦς), ἡ, guardship, Arr. An. 2.20.2.
carry round in procession, Sch. Ar. Pl. 1198 ( Pass.).
sending round about, Sch. A. Eu. 11.
toil about, Vett.Val. 361.21 ( Pass.).
very rascally, as a pun on περιφόρητος, Ἀρτέμων Ar. Ach. 850.
travel, go about, Pl. Lg. 716a, Ceb. 7 ; κατʼ οὐρανόν Iamb. Protr. 13; walk about, IG 42(1).123.125 (Epid.).

children.label: II
children.definition: go round, τὰ ἱερά Arist. Oec. 1353b20 ; τὰς πόλεις, τοὺς ναούς, etc., Plb. 3.7.3, 9.6.3, etc.; τὴν πόλιν κύκλῳ Id. 4.54.4 ; τὰς οἰκίας τῶν συγκλητικῶν D.S. 40.1, cf. Corn. ND 17.
fasten with a clasp round oneself, App. Hisp. 42.
that which is so fastened, Cyr.
edged with purple, ἱμάτια Crates Com. 31, Heraclid. Pol. 69; χιτωνίσκοι Plb. 3.114.4, etc.

π. ἐσθῆτες garments with a purple border, of the Roman toga praetexta or laticlavia, Id. 6.53.7; π. τήβεννα, τήβεννος, D.H. 2.70, Plu. Rom. 26; and περιπόρφυρος alone, ib. 25, Aet.Gr. 2.283a ; π. (sc. παῖδες), pueri praetextati, Id. Publ. 18.
π. ἀγών part of name of an athletic contest at Sidon, IG 3.129 (iii A. D.), CPHerm. 54.13 (iii A. D.).
= Lat. puer praetextatus, AP 12.185 ( Strat.).
hover about, τὰ δʼ ἀεὶ ζῶντα (sc. τὰ μαντεῖα) περιποτᾶται S. OT 482 (lyr.): c. acc., Hld. 2.22.

definition: περίποτος, ον, ( πίνω) of a cup,

children.definition: to be drunk from on both sides (to explain δέπας ἀμφικύπελλον), Ath. 11.783b.
about, ἔτη γεγονὼς περίπου ἑκκαίδεκα Hdn. 5.7.4, cf. 7.5.2, Paul.Aeg. 4.1, etc.
fitting close, as a shoe to the foot, Hsch., Phot. (better divisim, περὶ ποδός and περὶ πόδα).
district for purposes of taxation, PMasp. 9 ii 20 (vi A. D.).
burning all round, ὅλου τοῦ σώματος Philum. Ven. 24.3.
very, especially, Il. 11.180, Call. Jov. 86.
throw round before, τινί τι Opp. H. 4.657.
run forward and round, Opp. H. 2.440, 4.89.
to be poured all round, used by Hom. in aor. part., ἔρος . . θυμὸν ἐνὶ στήθεσσι περιπροχῠθεὶς ἐδάμασσε love rushing in a flood over my heart overcame it, Il. 14.316.
Com.Adesp. 1114.
stumble upon, c. dat., Polyaen. 1.3.2 ; fall into, ἐνέδρᾳ Id. 4.2.18 : mostly metaph. of calamity, Plu. Pyrrh. 10 (v.l.); ἑτέροις ἀφʼ ἑτέρων J. AJ 17.5.5; ὀλέθρῳ Tryph. 312: abs., Ph. 2.62.
fall in with, ὀνείδεσι f.l. for περιπεπτωκότων in Arist. Fr. 487.
joints connecting the arms of an aircatapult with the air-chambers, Ph. Bel. 78.19.
bandage for the heel, Sor. Fasc. 60, Orib. 48.67 tit.
flying round about : περίπτερα πυρός sparks of fire, LXX Ca. 8.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: with a single row of columns all round it, προστάς, οἶκος, Callix. 1, cf. LXX Am. 3.15, Vitr. 3.2.1.
surrounded by a gallery, Ath.Mech. 11.8.
skins of grapes, Sch. Ar. Nu. 45, Eq. 803 (with vv. Il.).

strip off the husk or skin, Thphr. HP 9.16.9, Dieuch. ap. Orib. 4.7.21 :— Pass., Thphr. HP 4.4.10, Sor. 1.122 : metaph., περιεπτισμένοι free from the chaff, clean-winnowed, Ar. Ach. 507; π. τὸ εἶδος clean-built, taper of form, Philostr. Her. 3.4.
anything folded round, covering, E. Ion 1391.
folding, π. ἐξαιρῖτις folding ladder, Ath. Mech. 36.7.
folding oneself round, embracing, τοῦ νεκροῦ Plu. Cat.Mi. 11 (pl.); περιπτύξεις καὶ ἁφαί Plot. 4.7.8.

enfold, enshroud, τινὰ τύμβῳ S. Ant. 886 ; πέπλοι περιπτύσσοντες δέμας E. Hec. 735 ; π. γόνυ, δέμας, clasp, embrace it, Id. IA 992, Med. 1206 (v.l. χέρας) ; ὥς σε περιπτύξω Bion 1.44 ; π. ταῖς χερσί Plb. 13.7.8, etc.; ὀλοῇσι π. γενύεσσι, of a dragon, A.R. 4.155 :— Pass., Aristaenet. 1.1.
outflank, X. An. 1.10.9 :— Pass., Id. Cyr. 7.1.26.
Med., embrace, Jul. Ep. 193.

children.label: II
children.definition: fold round, π. χέρας fold the arms round another, E. Alc. 350, Andr. 417 :— Med. and Pass., fold oneself round, coil round, Pl. Smp. 196a ; ἡ γαστὴρ -πτύσσεται τῇ τροφῇ Gal. 6.303 : c. acc., τήνδε τὴν μερίδα τῆς βασιλείας δύο . . ἔθνη περιπτύσσεται Lib. Or. 59.89.

data.quote: τήνδε τὴν μερίδα τῆς βασιλείας δύο . . ἔθνη περιπτύσσεται

children.definition: apply, τι τόπῳ Philum. Ven. 7.6.

that which enfolds, used in pl. in poet. periphrasis, τειχέων περιπτυχαί enfolding walls, E. Ph. 1357 ; δόμων Ar. Av. 1241 (parody of E.); Ἀχαιῶν ναύλοχοι π. their naval cloak or fence, E. Hec. 1015 ; πέπλων π. Trag.Adesp. 91.

children.label: II
children.definition: enfolding, embracing, περιπτυχαῖσι δὴ χέρας προσαρμόσασα E. Supp. 815 (lyr.); ἐν ἡλίου περιπτυχαῖς in all that the sun embraces, i.e.all the world, Id. Ion 1516.
folded round, φᾶρος S. Aj. 915.
φασγάνῳ π. fallen around ( i.e. upon) his sword, ib. 899.
spit upon, περιπτυόμενον ἀμελεῖται Aristaenet. 1.21, cf. Porph. Chr. 63.
accidental happening : hence,
calamity, Pl. Prt. 345b.
lucky chance, LXX Ru. 2.3.
encountering, falling into the earthʼs shadow, Cleom. 2.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: = foreg., S.E. P. 1.144 (pl.), Hld. 6.14, etc. ; ἀπὸ περιπτώσεως S.E. M. 1.25.

children.label: III
children.definition: experience, ξυγκαταινέω . . τὸν λογισμόν, ἤνπερ ἐκ περιπτώσιος ποιέηται τὴν ἀρχήν Hp. Praec. 1 ; οὔτε πεῖρα οὔτε π. Plu. Aet. phys. 2.918c tit. ; ἄλογος τριβὴ καὶ π. ib. Virt.mor. 440a ; κατὰ περίπτωσιν ἐγνωσμένον Stoic. 2.29, al., cf. Phld. Rh. 2.164S., Diog.Oen. 10 (pl.).
fear greatly, τι Musae. 206 (dub.): abs., APl. 16.110.
falling into that which one seeks to avoid, Epicurei ap. Plu. Def.orac. 2.420d, Arr. Epict. 3.6.6, etc.; τῷ κακῷ M.Ant. 10.7. Adv. -κῶς Arr. Epict. 4.10.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: accidental, π. εἶδος ἐμπειρίας Gal. Sect. Intr. 2. Adv. -κῶς S.E. M. 1.25.
suppuration round about, Hp. Epid. 4.52.
encompass thickly, κόμη with foliage, Ach.Tat. 1.15 :— Med., have thick round, τὰς τρίχας περὶ τὸ σῶμα Ctes. Fr. 57.11.
vessel for containing fire, IG 11(2).203 B 45,219 B 53 ( Delos, iii B. C.), SIG 996.13 ( Smyrna, i A. D.).
widely known, celebrated, A.R. 4.213, Parth. 25.3, App. BC 2.88, Coluth. 75, AP 7.42, etc.
cover with a lid all over, Hp. Loc.Hom. 47, Ph. 2.324 :— Pass., to be closely covered, Arist. Juv. 470a9.
Pass., to be shut up in, ἐὰν περιπωμασθῇ ὀλίγος ἀήρ Id. HA 592a22.
= foreg. [περιπωμάζω] I [cover with a lid all over], Arist. Pr. 930b2 ( Pass.), Thphr. Ign. 43.
torn or broken round about, AP 7.542 ( Stat. Flacc.).

besprinkle, Thphr. Lap. 13 ; esp. in sacred rites, μιᾶς ἐκ χέρνιβος βωμοὺς π. Ar. Lys. 1130 :— Med., purify oneself, ὕδατι περίρρανʼ (i.e. περίρραναι) Men. 530.23, cf. Plu. Lyc. 2 ; ἀπὸ συνουσίας περιραναμένους IG 12(1).789.15 ( Rhodes, ii A. D.), cf. SIG 982.8 ( Pergam., ii B. C. in form -ρασάμενοι) π. ἀπὸ ἱεροῦ Thphr. Char. 16.2 ; ἐπὶ θαλάττης ib. 13 ; ἀπὸ [κρήνης] Aristobul. 6 J.; οὐλοχύταις Nonn. D. 5.7 ( Pass.), etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: moisten, ὕδασι . . ἀρούρας ib. 14.48.
pour, οἶνον . . Ὑμεναίῳ ib. 29.156.
-έρρανται στιγμαῖς Philum. Ven. 20.1.
something stitched on, Hsch. s.v. ἄκανθος.
lustral besprinkling, Pl. Cra. 405b.

utensil for besprinkling, esp. whisk for sprinkling water at sacrifices, or vessel for lustral water, Hdt. 1.51, Porph. Abst. 2.27 (pl.):—written περιραντήριον in Inscrr., IG 2(2).1641.38, 11(2).287 A 93 ( Delos, iii B. C.), SIG 253 ii 10 ( Delph., iv B. C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: περιρραντήρια ἀγορᾶς the parts of the market-place sprinkled with lustral water, Lex ap. Aeschin. 1.21, cf. 3.176, Luc. Sacr. 12, 13.

children.label: III
children.definition: = foreg., Ph. 1.156, al., Luc. Pseudol. 23.
sprinkler, temple-official at Sardes, BMus.Inscr. 1031 (= Sardis 7(1).117, i B. C.).
LXX Nu. 19.13, al.; v.l. for -νοτίζω in Alex.Trall. 1.15.
